PRIMITIVE GAMEMODE The early of can be the most exciting, unfortunately players rush to fully automatic rifles as fast as possible to get an edge over their enemies. What if the early could last forever? The primitive mode brings us to a distant future where the knowledge of high tech items have been lost, leaving the inhabitants of the island only able to make basic items. The following apply to the primitive mode. Allowed Weapons Melee Bow, Compound Bow, Crossbow, Mini Crossbow Speargun Eoka Beancan Grenade, Molotov Flashlight Attachment Shields Restricted Armor Facemask Metal Chest Plate Resources Less Sulfur Nodes Spawn Increased Tech Tree Tax Loot Jackhammer Chainsaw loot only travelling vendor trades Raiding All Rockets MLRS Building Metal Building Grade Armored Building Grade Armored Doors, Rockets Explosive ammo World Modifications Monuments Oil Rig, Missile Silo, Excavator, Underwater Labs Underground Train System Scientist NPCs vendors remain Disabled Patrol Heli Event Disabled Cargo Ship Event Disabled Bradley APC Increased Wild Horse Spawns Travel Helicopters Minicopter, Scrap Transport Helicopter, Attack Helicopter WEAPONS Introducing vehicles the weapons! Designed for early raiding, they all craftable and deployable in the wilds. A great addition to your raiding and grubbing arsenal. In addition to the cost to craft, building them will require extra materials and a hammer They are both available in the primitive and vanilla modes, from the workbench level. CATAPULT The catapult is capable of launching powerful projectiles with a large impact radius. It comes with ammunition items Scattershot multiple rocks in a spread Firebomb ignites on impact, spreading flames Propane Explosive Bomb explosives, damages construction It can launch players. Use at your own risk. CATAPULT AMMO You can use the Firebomb and Propane bombs as a deployable raiding tool. Once deployed they will start to spark when they take any damage and explode after several seconds. When used in this way bombs will do less damage. TOWER The Tower provides a way to get into compounds, high open windows or help with a raid. As the heaviest Weapon, these towers lack some mobility, but make up for it in strength. the other Weapons The Tower can be towed by a horse, or pushed to get it into position. Each tower is levels tall, with a drawbridge on each level. Use the drawbridge to provide some protection as you assault a base. Each tower can have a door placed at the bottom for an layer of security. BATTERING RAM The battering ram is a heavy vehicle you can drive around. Its reinforced arm can be used to destroy wooden and stone constructions The ram takes damage with each hit and will need metal to stay operational. BALLISTA The ballista is a massive, wheeled crossbow designed for combat. It can be deployed on terrain and towed by horses. It can fire bolt items Pitchfork Bolt large sweeping projectile Piercer Bolt penetrates armored vehicles Hammerhead Bolt heavy and solid, deals damage to doors Incendiary Bolt ignites on impact, spreading flames A stationary version is available, which can be deployed within your base for defensive use. SHIELDS Shields are a backpack slot item that allows you handle frontal threats with ease. Simply equip the shield in your backpack slot and equip a compatible single handed weapon and the shield will automatically appear. While holding a shield it takes over the function of RMB, so you won t be able to aim down sights or throw weapons. Instead holding RMB will raise the shield in front of you, giving you more protection at the cost of reduced visibility and not being able to sprint. You can only hold a Shield up for seconds before having to put it back down, this is shown via a small progress bar near the crosshair similar to the Compound Bow. There are shield variants, each with a different damage block amount. This amount is the percentage of damage that the shield absorbs from any incoming attack, the remaining portion will be received by the holding the shield. While equipped you ll see a shield durability bar appear above your health bar, any damage a shield takes is applied to its durability and once broken the shield will be unequipped. Items that are compatible with shields will mention this on their item information panel when selected. When not in use Shields will appear on your back, note that while they are on your back they provide no protection. You will need to equip the shield in order to block any attacks. SHOT MINI CROSSBOW In the spirit of a primitive mode, we wanted to add another arrow weapon. The Mini Crossbow is a fresh take on the Crossbow. Providing shots in a rotating barrel, at the cost of some damage and range. The Mini Crossbow will not only be a great addition to the base, but the primitive gamemode. HORSES Horses have been completely overhauled and should feel much better to with. They can now traverse most terrain types and monuments movement mechanics allow them to skid by pressing CTRL when galloping They can swim, trees and be pulled when led Horses can tow weapons, including the catapult, tower, and ballista. Additionally, their impact on server performance has been massively improved. MEDIEVAL PACK DLC This month, we re introducing the Medieval Pack DLC a themed collection featuring items and skins consisting of the Medieval Barricade, Knights Armour clothing skins, Medieval Large Wood Box skin, the Medieval Assault Rifle skin and Medieval skins for the Sheet Metal Door and Double Doors. The pack can be purchased from the item. Knight Armour Set Arise a brave Knight with these chivalric skins for the Coffeecan Helmet, Roadsign Jacket and Roadsign Kilt. Medieval Barricade Lay down this barricade to stave off the most ardent attackers, or augment the battlefield with its unique visuals. Note that you will need to know the Barbed Wooden Barricade blueprint to craft this. Medieval Assault Rifle Kingmaker or Kingslayer you call the shots with this resplendent relic. Medieval Large Wooden Box Every Lord needs a sturdy coffer to their spoils of war. Look no further than this stalwart companion. Medieval Sheet Metal Door Double Door Survey your lands from behind these imposing castle doors, uniquely adorned with spikes to keep the nakeds out. The pack can be purchased from the item. RAGDOLLS Temporary ragdolling has been for bikes and horses. Taking large amounts of collision damage on bikes and horses will result in the being flung from their seat and eventually getting back up assuming they have died in the process. Players can be flung from the saddle of a horse if it had too much airtime or has slid too far. Horses will ragdoll in these cases as well. If you unlucky enough to be used as ammunition for a catapult, you ragdoll and are guaranteed to die on impact. Collision damage on bikes has been with ragdolls in mind, with the aim of making it less likely to instantly die from hitting obstacles on a bike. FIRST PERSON ADMIN ESP We been slowly building up the feature set of our admin ESP system over the years, mostly due to the demands of various streaming events. This was restricted to using the camera, it will now work as expected while in first person perspective spectating. Many server admins have asked for this to have better situational awareness while spectating players. It uses the same convars as the normal ESP system so you should need to do anything. All of the existing convars will apply, this includes If there are further improvements that would help in live spectating, please let us know! QUALITY OF LIFE Pickup sleeping bags Players can now pick up any sleeping bag as long they are in TC range IO Reskinning Can now reskin IO deployables with the spray can without disconnecting it entirely Phone names Phones can now have names up to characters long Pumpkin Rolling Dropped pumpkins no longer roll indefinitely Backpacks on Weapon Racks Backpacks and shields can now be used with weapon racks. SOCIAL INTEGRATIONS We rolling out a social integration layer to this month, no more messing around with overlays or you can now view, chat, invite, and add friends, all from right inside the. Your friends list will automatically sync up. No setup required. Prefer using Discord? No problem! All you need to do is link your account, and your Discord friends will be right there, ready to connect. This way, you ve got the best of both worlds. Give it a try, and as always, let us know what you think. TWITCH DROPS HOME BREWED Twitch Drops are back! And from more of our favourite creators on the rise that you should definitely start to recognize! Be sure to sync up at to claim your Drops after watching these fantastic creators on Twitch. SERVER PROFILER LINUX REDUCED OVERHEAD TL DR Shipping Linux binary Server profiler should have less impact when idle and recording by gathering less data if it fails to generate a snapshot, you can now export a debug binary snapshot and share it with us. Linux Support This will contain a library built for Linux environment. The library is a native recorder, so the interface the perfsnapshot command works the same. The library has been built on Ubuntu via GCC in mode and it depends on POSIX utilities dlopen, dlsym so it should be accessible everywhere. Profiler Overhead Since the first release of our internal profiler, we got the opportunity to test it in the real world conditions. My first tests were rough could only capture frames worth of data before ballooning to multiple gigabytes of data and I got feedback from number of server owners that not only it does produce snapshots in some situations, it has idle overhead just enabling profiler can have a on a server. I spent some time this cycle to to reduce this overhead, as in the current conditions it severely reduces the benefit we can get out of the tool. I tackled it from a couple angles Reduced how much Code we capture The profiler works by annotating every code method that it encounters, wrapping it in a set of calls that dispatch to different Mono profilers. Comparatively, for complex and expensive methods these call are unnoticeable, but for small utility functions that do a trivial thing change a bool, set a bit, append to a list, etc the dispatching calls add massive overhead we talking the cost of the utility function. Lastly, these dispatching calls are cheaper when the profiler is enabled, but not capturing but they are still not free. Originally I set up a number of annotation filters to exclude some known and safe code stuff from namespace, for example, but it still left a lot of fat that we could trim. Here the before and after of the affecting our processing loop As you can see there much less of nested calls reduced verticality, and instant calls triangles, they take less than Perfetto is able to track appear much earlier. This we no longer capture Hash functions Casting comparison operators Property getters related code Enumerators Anything Math related Our internal collections BufferList Serialization code There more, but hopefully you see the principle behind the choice anything small, trivial or reliable gets ignored. This allowed us to massively reduce the amount of data we generate during capture on staging server, we used to generate about of json per, after these it gone down to of json per. This should reduce the idle overhead, since there much less dispatch code that scattered around. Improved json generation logic of the quirks that we have to deal with data is that it does know where the frame begins and ends it just a stream of method records frame end record that happens somewhere deep in the managed callstack. And since we want to display the data in a organized matter, we need to scan this stream to figure out how to partition all records. Originally I implemented a version of this because I assumed that there would be too much data to overwhlem this process. Since the previous section showed that I was wrong on the scale of data, I spent a bit of time to improve the export process we now only need scans to figure out frame grouping, instead of originally, so using, this gives us export speedup. Additionally, I received reports that profiler can fail to generate snapshots. There are a couple scenarios in the above logic that can cause it to fail, so for these cases I the option to dump a binary debug snapshot just run perfsnapshot, and you should see a in folder. I be able to inspect it in our internal tool to see what am I missing Future Plans I been using this tool on the daily to inspect the state of our Staging servers, and I hoping to do the same with our medium and release servers as well. To squeeze out the most, there are additional improvements that I to pursue when the time allows Continue trimming down on annotated functions there still plenty to reduce. Need to expose the annotation filter to server owners right now it all hardcoded which is limiting Need to expand allocation tracking right now we just track how much we allocated on main thread. We could track allocated object types, and figure out a better way to display it on Perfetto. Emit more metadata about the performance state provide manual annotation tools to emit the scope of workload for our, or to show dependencies. Explore automatic capture during frame spikes. YEARS Servers are now wiped and Santa is packing up and clearing out the bodies, but we hope you enjoyed the Holiday Season. We getting back to work after a couple of weeks off, which is why this blog is lighter than usual, but we looking forward to the journey ahead in! At the end of last year, we celebrated anniversary, marking an incredible journey. The continues to experience growth, which is quite remarkable for being years old. is now bigger than ever! This year, we saw Over million sessions Over million hours played Over million unique players Here a recap of some of the major updates we did last year World This HUGE completely changed the world and many unique points of interest around the world Road Renegades forms of transport, bicycles and motorbikes Bags To Riches Finally backpacks allowing players to carry more items and the metal detector item Waves Of Change Updated the cargoship and helicopter events, additionally overhauled the Harbors Lighting The Way Allows players to see and navigate at night, we add a small illumination area around the Seismic Shift a item which will send notifications to your phone if an explosion is detected Quality Of Life Over QOL from saving codelocks to floating items Weapons weapons, the minigun, military flame thrower, SKS, High Calibre Revolver, Handmade SMG Alongside a metric ton of improvements and bug fixes. continues to be a labour of love from all of us at Facepunch, and we could have done it without your passion and feedback. Thank you for your continued support, be it playing the, telling friends, and engaging and communicating with us. We very much enjoyed everything we worked on for the this year. LOOKING FORWARD What s in for? Consistency! Continued guaranteed monthly updates on the first Thursday of every month, alongside regular fixes, enhancements, improvements, and exciting holiday events. Next Month On February, we release the Primitive. The will be of the most impactful updates to date in changing the dynamics of raiding and combat by introducing vehicles, primitive weapons, shields, and a dedicated mode. The Primitive represents a time in where the already scarce technology and the usual homemade armaments and ammunition have been depleted from current setting, forcing survivors to fashion crude weapons with less sophisticated methods of attack and defence. The Tower can be used to climb over exterior walls while players remain in cover. And it can be pushed or and has several floors, with extendable drawbridges that double up as shutters. The Catapult will be a projectile launcher for longer distances that can utilise multiple projectiles such as boulders, radioactive barrels, and propane tank IEDs. While it does have wheels, its size makes it something that a vehicle or horse will have to help you move it towards your next target. The Ballista is a combination of a catapult and a large crossbow which was highly accurate given the heft of its projectiles. And in, those features remain with the Ballista having multiple ammo types, being able to do heavy damage to people, doors, and vehicles. Finally, the Battering Ram will be another addition that is driveable a traditional vehicle, with a triggerable ram that damages building blocks in a radius. As well as these weapons and vehicles, we have been working on a variety of shields, a shot, and updates to melee damages and ranges. With this comes some improvements to horses, including their ability to tow the weapons, and skins to customise your primitive approach to gameplay and expression. Ca wait till February? Staging branch is publicly playable, allowing everyone to test and give feedback. Forwards Alongside next month Primitive, we have a ton of content currently in development, and if you keeping an eye on our commits page, you already know some of what on the way. This year, you can expect to see Cooking bringing many to food management and unique buffs to foods, a Jungle biome featuring dangerous animals such as crocodiles and tigers, and to softcore and hardcore modes. Outlined above is skimming the surface of only a few key features. We have a lot more planned. But what about? Performance? Performance is always an ongoing process. We constantly adding and improving features monthly, often hidden in changelogs. There is no magic button to increase performance. Instead, it is a slow process of small gains. We hired several people over the past couple of months whose sole job is focused on tasks, these are positions which never existed before, we never had staff dedicated to performance, they getting to grips with the project and are already hard at work identifying and fixing issues. A recent example is Daniel server profiler. We continue to share news on performance in our monthly development blogs. Old Content? As with prior years we set aside multiple months in our internal roadmap of light or no content. These gaps are deliberate to allow us to be versatile and adaptive to community feedback, have time to focus and address old content and improve recent content. We have a lot we can keep building upon, not all content we add to is supposed to become meta, but rather adding yet another way of achieving a goal. Cheating? Repeating the words of last year blog Anticheat is a hugely complex topic. We work closely with Epic Easy, to aid in detecting and banning cheaters in. We do disclose what we do and do do when it comes to for good reason. The more information we disclose publicly, the more it can assist cheaters and cheat developers to circumvent measures, it a huge. of the best measures is obscurity. The fewer people know what EAC and we are doing, the better. This comes with the drawback of not communicating enough, on the outside, it appears we doing nothing. Almost every month, we shipping improvements or cheat features. We fixed several exploits upon discovery or disclosure within hours through hotfixes we do note publicly. EAC sometimes pushes several improvements weekly, which are applied when you start the. We continue to promise to you is we actively monitoring and combating cheaters daily. Our internal systems keep improving, as do EAC. In past blogs I talked about culling, if a is behind a hill and you ca see them, do network the to disrupt ESP cheat features. We slowly iterating this and have tested it on live servers, we working on getting this to the most performant state possible to work on population servers. Another feature we exploring and want your feedback on it, is a form of premium servers. The overwhelming number of cheaters banned have inventory valued at below. A large number of regular players have inventories of over. If we used this as a gate to entry for some servers, it would mean these servers would see considerably fewer players, is this something you want? Would you on these servers? We still collecting data to determine the exact barrier to entry. The reason for looking at Inventory price, in short, is because it a metric that ca be spoofed and gamed easily, unlike data. The big negative here is servers rely on a steady flow of players, and old this gate could have a net negative impact on the server population and, thus, the overall gameplay experience we love to hear your thoughts. In January, we release a full blog in which we discuss how has gone, with highlights, learnings, and our plans for. QUALITY OF LIFE Peacekeeper Turret Hostile Indicator A turret icon now appears next to the usual hostile indicator when you are hostile and near a peace keeper auto turret. Workcart Storage A small box has been to all Workcarts so you can that extra loot. Waterpump Depth Change Waterpumps now work with a smaller depth of water, perfect for the rivers. Propane Tank Stack Size Propane tanks can now stack up to. Dropbox Input Increase Increased to input slots. Junkpile Despawn Junkpiles will now be eligible to despawn after they are partially looted. Fridge Storage Fridge storage increased to slots Homing Missiles Homing missiles have been to Bradley and attack helicopter loot crates WOLF PACKS BALANCING We spent this month bug fixing and improving the to the wolves, as we want them to feel challenging but not unfair. The problems Using fire against wolf sometimes felt less impactful than expected, especially when wanting to avoid the fight. Even though wolves would attack as long as you kept distance and a lit torch, they would follow for a very long time. This was especially aggravating when driving wolves away from your corpse to get back your loot, but then having them still follow you and potentially cause a death spiral. Furthermore, when jumping on an elevated position to escape the wolf, it would ignore the lit torch and rush to jump up. The wolf could do very fast huge jumps sometimes up to your base roof. The jump motion looked weightless and not believable. Another problem was packs of wolves. They did appear all the time, but players that had to face them had a hard time. Even though packs never spawn with more than wolves, they could sometimes merge. That because wolves always come to investigate when their hear a howl, even if it comes from a wolf that does not belong to their pack. Once the shot a wolf or they got close enough, wolves would give up stalking and weave at high speed towards their prey. For players that only had a bow, this made it hard to land more than or shot as the pack of wolves closed the gap. And once enough wolves were in melee range, while it was possible to prevent a single of them from attacking thanks to hit stun, you easily got overwhelmed. RADTOWN of the emblematic locations from legacy makes a comeback Radtown. We turned this monument from a bunch of blocky garage buildings, into a refreshed gameplay space. We tried to preserve the proportions and purpose of each location while opening up paths and adding way to improve the flow of movement and cover throughout. Exteriors Interiors CLIFFS We have completely reworked all cliffs in the. The cliffs come in types, tall coastal cliffs placed close to the ocean and sloped inland cliffs covering hills and mountains. A lot of effort was made into making them not only look realistic, but easy to traverse. You can run up the inland cliffs with ease, while the coastal cliffs can be scaled by jumping on the rocky ledges and protrusions. In addition we have many coastal rocks close to the shore to further spice up the world. REVAMPED ROCK FORMATIONS We have completely revamped all large rock formations in the and decided to bring back some of the old fan favorites. Formations such as the god rock, anvil rock and arch rock all return to the. Completely rock formations have been and some of them even spawn off shore allowing for more base building possibilities than ever before. UNIQUE ENVIRONMENTS In, you will now find several different canyons, lakes, and oasis of various sizes in each procedurally generated map. Canyons, Lakes, and Oases each offering a fresh way to with their own pros and cons. Canyons provide narrow pathways for ambushes but can be risky to navigate. Lakes create opportunities for resource gathering and farming but leave you vulnerable in open water. Oases are lush safe havens with valuable resources but will become hotspots for fierce competition. Canyons These towering landscapes offer fresh opportunities for ambushes and base building. While the narrow pathways and steep drops make for thrilling combat and strategic locations. Canyons can be rich in resources, but do get too greedy and get caught out. Lakes These scenic water bodies add a twist to the gameplay, offering great spots for fishing, resource gathering, farming and by the shore. However, the open water leaves you exposed to attacks, and swimming can slow you down when trying to make a quick escape. Oasis These rare paradises amidst the harsh desert. These lush areas are perfect for setting up base, gathering, farming, and finding vital resources water. But be warned Oases will attract other players looking to take advantage of these havens. RIVERS Rivers are now longer, flow more naturally, and widen the longer they get. This as well as the unique environments required a larger water system overhaul to support different water types at any altitude. The ocean is now fully culled underneath the terrain, and lakes no longer stretch beyond their boundaries. Overall, it a much more robust and future proof system. HIGH CALIBER REVOLVER The High Caliber Revolver is a, revolver that uses ammo. Built for precise, shots rather than rapid fire, it demands a steady hand for maximum accuracy. Its slower fire rate reflects the design, but the power and precision make each shot count. Unlockable at a Tier workbench, the High Caliber is for survivors who prioritize accuracy and impact over speed. LEGACY WOOD PILE Welcome back wood piles! These will spawn in the snow, and temperate biomes. They function just our traditional ore piles, but for wood! Harvestable with a rock, hatchet or chainsaw. A great source of wood early in the to start off your journey. DIVE SITES Ocean Wreck Buoys We ve remodelled the old floating bottle indicators on the surface of dive sites into more solid buoys. They are much more visible which will help with finding dive sites. Dive Sites The Dive Sites themselves have been refreshed this month, with an entirely set of three possible options replacing the old sites. All sites now spawn the same amount of loot crates. Each site has unique environment art and topology. Flora and Fauna Alongside the Buoys and Dive Sites, we overhauled the underwater foliage with a graphical, and tweaked the visuals on fish so they behave more naturally. You might even find a couple of other critters down there. DIVER PROPULSION VEHICLE DPV We small handheld dive vehicle this month. The DPV can be crafted and kept in your inventory until you need it. It then used so Select it and deploy it into any water that at least metre deep Interact with the fuel tank and add some low grade fuel Mount it to hold onto the handles and drive it around Using the DPV, you can travel underwater significantly faster than you could by swimming. Once you done with it, simply dismount and pick it up. Fuel will automatically be and to your inventory, or dropped if you do have any space. Note Currently players will need to manually remove fuel before picking up the DPV. This will be corrected in a hotfix asap WATER WELL Waterwells aren t exactly the most popular monument in, so this month we decided to make them a little more interesting. You will now find a vendor at some NPC s that can offer a random selection of teas and farming equipment that shuffles every minutes. What s special about this NPC is that this is the first vendor that is available in non safe zones. This means they can be killed! If that happens they will respawn after a while, but that won t trigger the vendor to refresh or have any loot so there s no real purpose. Try and be nice! You will find a food cache with basic teas and high quality food items, and some planters that are automatically filled with random plants periodically. These plants have a high priority of having good genes, so they re a great way to give your farm base a quick boost. RADIOACTIVE WATER We a gameplay feature to the world Radioactive Water! This is available at locations in the Radtown monument. Players will be able to harvest it with any regular water container, be it a bota bag, water jug or the tanker module for vehicles. Radioactive Water has a few properties splashing it on plants will instantly kill them, splashing it on players via throwing your water from a container, or via a sprinkler will irradiate them. Carrying a large amount of it in your inventory will damage you, and finally looting a players body will irradiate you if there enough radioactive water in their inventory. These properties make Radioactive Water a great choice for a number of things from instantly resetting your farm, to being a great to those players raiding you in full gear. The backend work done on Radioactive Water opens up a number of gameplay possibilities in the future as any item in code can now be marked as Radioactive. BICYCLES Bicycles can now be found across the map on roadsides, and at several monuments. The standard bike takes, but a variant allows a second to sit and shoot from the rear. The bicycles are as fast or as the motorbikes, but they easier to acquire, and they do use any fuel. Instead, they slowly consume your own food and water levels. Holding Sprint while biking will have the driver stand up and give you a bit more temporary power and speed. Sprint mode will automatically engage if you struggling up a hill. This feature wears out after a few seconds and needs time to recharge. HANDCUFFS AND PRISONER HOOD Take your enemies captive with the Handcuff and Prisoner Hood items! Use the Handcuffs on a surrendering friendly gesture or downed to take them prisoner restricting their inventory, belt, use and interact options. Handcuffed players can be pushed around and forced into vehicles and other mountables. Place the Prisoner Hood on your victim to block their vision and disable their map access, preventing them from seeing where you are taking them. Handcuffed players can hold their attack button to progress the unlock minigame. Fill the progress bar and the Handcuffs break, releasing you! Unlock progress is tied to the Handcuff item condition so that you can always eventually get free but being damaged or pushed will temporarily interrupt your breakout attempt! Additionally, performing the friendly gesture at any time lets other players inspect your full inventory and modify your belt a great way to show you not a threat or hiding something valuable! TRAVELLING VENDOR We a brand event! The Travelling Vendor. The vendor will spawn naturally on maps with ring roads and traverse the roads. The vendor sells a selection of wares from basic building materials to some of the best items in the. QUALITY OF LIFE Ceiling Light Wiring Ceiling lights IO points are now easier to target Improved Barricade Placement Can now place barricades on rocks and dirt roads DYNAMIC VENDOR PRICING To introduce a little more variety into the NPC vending system, this month we have introduced a change that increases or decreases the sale price of items purchased with scrap based on that item s popularity. The way it works is we now keep a running total of the average number of items sold every hours. Every hours if the number sold is less than the average then the price of the item will drop by for the next hours down to a minimum of. If the number of items sold has increased above the average then its price will be increased by to a maximum of extra, or twice the price. We will be starting prices at so they will likely drop for a while before settling to the market price. An example of the logic The average amount of SAM sites purchased in a hour window is, and the current price has no increases or decreases. At the end of a hour window we check and see that SAM sites have been purchased. Since the average has gone up, we raise the price by. Since the price is now more expensive, sales drop to over the next hours. Since this is below the average we then drop the price by, which results in a price increase in total. You can see the current discount and price when looking at an item on the map or, the price displayed is the final price and there s a small indicator that communicates what the current price change is and what that item s initial price was. You can easily tell at a glance what items are cheap and what items are expensive, as well as how much they ve changed price to make informed purchasing decisions. We ve only applied this to sales where the currency paid is scrap vending machines that offer scrap in exchange for items fish market, resource exchange, etc are unaffected. This will not apply to created vending machines. Why are we making this change? We believe the NPC vending meta can be shaken up a bit and this seems a fairer change than us just arbitrarily changing a bunch of prices across the board. This way the prices will increase and decrease based on behaviour and will vary from server to server. As usual we ll monitor how this goes over the next month and make as necessary. FURTHER MEMORY IMPROVEMENTS Building on last month work to reduce the overall number of objects in to save memory, this month we are rolling out even more improvements. We applied the same principle reducing the number of objects by combining them when possible but at the project level, so that most assets are already combined and streamlined in the build and don t need to be processed when starting the up. The streamlining process we use here is even more aggressive and results in even greater memory savings while reducing time spent processing assets. As well as these optimisations, we re going to be making last month renderer improvements now enabled by default. We believe this approach combined with last month improvements has resulted in about a gigabyte of reduced memory usage on a fresh server. This was a huge effort as it involved manually modifying hundreds of assets across the entire. Thanks to the valiant efforts of our QA we ve identified many cases where slight unintentional material and colour occurred but it s possible some more snuck through into the release so please let us know if you see anything that looks incorrect! Just last month, we have more improvements in the pipeline for next month including memory improvements to monument foliage and a process for loading monuments that will hopefully reduce loading times and further reduce memory usage. Our current issue is that it s quite trivial to endlessly produce fish from a safe zone, then converting that fish to scrap. It s not the fastest way to earn scrap but it is pretty reliable. Our intention with the range of fish available to catch was always that you would work your way up the chain catch a sardine, use that to catch a trout, use that to catch a shark. By allowing raw fish meat to be used as a bait you could easily gut fish and catch dozens more fish with that meat, which could then be converted into even more fish. To break this loop, this month raw fish meat is now only worth bait and can be used in stacks of whole fish can and should be used as bait but you now run the risk of losing that fish when casting out. The idea is to introduce a mechanic. Do you cash out with your current trout catch or do you put them on line and for the sharks? To balance out this reduction in bait, we ve made several other forms of bait more useful. Several bait types can now be stacked if a fish requires bait to be caught and you stack Worms worth each, you can now catch that fish. This behaviour is applied across worms, grubs, berries and small fish, making these baits more viable. We ve increased the bait value of human meat, bear meat and wolf meat. The stack amount can be seen next to the bait value when selecting the item in your inventory. The Survival Fish Trap became a bit neglected after we introduced the Fishing Rod, so this month we ve adjusted it to make it more relevant. RENDERER MEMORY SAVINGS In hack week this month, I explored ways to reduce our memory usage, an area that is a real priority for us this year. While a lot of my experiments weren t workable, did actually end up saving several hundred megabytes of memory for very little cost, so it s shipping as disabled by default this month. A renderer in this case is simply a thing that is visible to the a crate, a rock, part of a structure, etc. Importantly for performance each renderer has LODs Level of Detail lower quality versions of each renderer that we switch to based on the distance to the players perspective. In Unity each of these LODs typically lives on a child object of a master parent object, so will have a child,, etc that we switch to. What I discovered during hack week is that in a proc gen map of size, we can have upwards of million objects in the world, each of these objects has some overhead we need to its position, rotation, what the object does, etc. In a renderers case, for every single renderer we had child objects, for each LOD level. I realised that in most cases each LOD object was just sharing a duplicate of all the information except for a different model, so I modified the system to detect when this happens and consolidate all needed information into a single object, then delete the child objects. By applying this to every renderer in the world, I was able to delete thousand objects from the world, which had a combined memory saving of pretty significant! This combination process is run every time the is launched, we re currently working on a change to make most of these modifications before we build the, which should yield further savings next month. Due to how risky this change is deleting thousand objects has had some unintended side effects that we ve now fixed, we re shipping this feature off by default, but we ll monitor it s usage through the month and likely turn it on by default sometime next month. The convar is and you ll need to restart your after turning it on or off. Let us know how it goes for you! tldr less objects less RAM HORSE IMPROVEMENTS It would be amiss to say horses have not had their share of issues over the last few months. AIMCONE REDUCTION Any movement in would modify your baseline Aimcone so that shots taken while in motion were somewhat inaccurate. This was supposed to discourage running and gunning. The problem with this is that any kind of motion while in a firefight puts you at a disadvantage minor dodging and increases the amount of RNG experienced by the. What I done is reduced this penalty to zero to start, and blend it up to the full amount after rapid fire shots. This means is you can now strafe and dodge while tap firing and not experience a huge aiming penalty, however full auto will be penalized. I adjusted the Aimcone curve modifiers for a few weapons so that more shots have a higher probability of landing closer to the center. This has been applied to the Custom SMG, SAP and. CARGO SHIP DOCKING We ve given both Harbors a fresh coat of paint this month, with a significant amount of visual and gameplay. These support the Cargo Ship docking process, which allows the ship to adjust it course and dock with the harbor. Each harbor has a island that can be reached by crossing a rotating bridge, floating containers or a daring set of jumps across cranes. This island becomes a stronghold once the Cargo Ship docks as it becomes sheltered from the rest of the harbor. The ship will pick the first harbor it passes to dock and will only dock once. Once docked, the cranes in the Harbor will spring into life and move several containers from the docks onto the deck of the ship. These containers have openable doors and can be hidden in, so they present a way to smuggle aboard the ship and another threat for players already on the ship to contend with. These containers will be deposited in locations that are generally above the deck, in some cases by several meters. This should present an interesting tactical situation when attacking the ship as well as defending it. We ve ship doors above the water line that allow access to the lower interior level of the ship and provide additional ways to board or traverse the monument while the ship is docked. By default the Cargo Ship replenishes it loot every minutes up to times. When the ship docks at the harbor it will attempt to trigger of those loot refreshes, although if all three have already happened it will be unable to spawn any more loot. The Cargo Ship horn will sound seconds prior to it departure once you hear that horn it time to get moving or you might end up back out at sea. We think these combined will lead to Cargo Ship being a much more contested PvP environment for groups of all sizes. We interested to see how a traditionally lower intensity monument the Harbors adjust to periodic bouts of high intensity action. ELECTRICITY This month we are taking care of our fellow electricians! Bug fixes, quality of life improvements, and major are coming to electricity. While being a great quality of life for master electricians, we believe that removing this pain point will increase the use of electricity in general. Therefore, the following components wo require power or drain batteries anymore Splitter Electrical Branch Blocker Root Combiner Memory Cell RAND Switch XOR Switch AND Switch OR Switch Timer Switch Smart Switch Pressure Pad Button Any other active components turrets, sensors, lights, etc remain unchanged and will still need power to function. Expect more in the coming months, including plans to rework some components and extending their functionalities. Many thanks to our electricians community for pointing out bugs and suggesting ideas. TUTORIAL ISLAND A common story we hear from players is that they have seen their playing, so they pick up the and then bounce off it due to how harsh and unforgiving the experience can be. This month s Tutorial Island is our attempt to provide players with a safe environment to learn the basic controls and mechanics of before being set loose in the main with other players. Everyone will be prompted to start the tutorial when they first spawn this month, if you re a long term feel free to decline the tutorial and we won t ask you about it again. Once the starts the Tutorial, they will be respawned on a dedicated island where an NPC will guide them through the first half hour of gameplay. This island is tightly controlled and can not be reached by other players. Throughout this process players will learn some key concepts Basic movement Crafting Building bases Upgrading bases Respawning Basic combat Resources Looting containers Cooking Using Furnaces Workbenches Using a vehicle This obviously isn t an exhaustive list of everything there is to learn in, but we feel this is a good starting point for a. Our guiding principle when designing this sequence has been if a emulates exactly what they did on the Tutorial Island once they get into the main, will they have a fighting chance? The tutorial itself should take less than minutes if you re familiar with general FPS controls and concepts, likely around an hour if you are not a regular FPS. Once complete you will be dropped off into the main with the same resources as any other completing the Tutorial Island does not give you any advantages in regular gameplay. For server owners running mods that change core gameplay features, you may find that parts of the tutorial don t work or maybe showing the tutorial isn t appropriate for your server minigame servers for instance. You can control whether the tutorial is active via the convar it false by default. While false players wo be prompted to start the tutorial on your server and they will not be able to manually start the tutorial. We ve a server tag to help players find and filter servers by their tutorial compatibility, add tut to your server tags to advertise your tutorial compatibility. Brand players will have this filter on when they first use the server browser. VENDOR UI REFRESH Our outdated tooltip popup for checking vendor stock urgently needed an upgrade. It felt out of place when compared with the marketplace UI. Thus, a plan was devised to merge both into a single unified system. This will be rolled out in parts, with this being part. This first part fully replaces the old blue tooltip popup with an interface that clearer, more, and scalable. Now, it easy to understand what you purchasing and how much is costs. Overall, this first pass on the vendor UI provides a great foundation to expand on. Single Vendor Interface Items are now displayed clearly with the cost and stock counts easily visible. Multi Vendor Interface Accordions are used to hold vendors with large amounts of listings. This keeps everything easy to, whilst still giving users flexibility to add a bunch of listings. While working on this, we noticed some QOL issues with finding items before purchasing. The marketplace offers useful features search and filtering that the standard map does have. It would be great to have these abilities everywhere. Part will unify the marketplace UI with the vendor UI. You will still have to travel to the marketplace to buy things via drone, but the actual underlying UI will be merged together. This will provide the same functionalities as enjoyed at the marketplace to the regular map vendor UI, whilst bringing the improved style and ease of use of this vendor UI to the marketplace. NIGHTLIGHT Today, I addressing an issue we often hear about from the community. Navigating the during nighttime. While the night cycle is a cruicial element of the gameplay loop, it can be a literal stumbling block not seeing what directly ahead. The problem of gamma hacking where players unfairly enhance their night vision by tweaking monitor settings, has been a thorn in our side, necessitating a darkness RGB to counteract such exploits. To that end I come up with the Nightlight feature. Basically it a shader that subtly illuminates a small radius around the, mimicking the effect of natural moon light. This localized lighting ensures that while you can see just enough to navigate at night, the vast darkness beyond remains dark. Distant pixels are kept at absolute darkness RGB, effectively rendering gamma hacking useless for spotting threats or resources. beyond a few meters We believe this approach strikes a good balance, enhancing the night experience without compromising fair. I hope it helps! REDUCING SERVER SIDE ENTITY COUNTS As mentioned in our start of the year blog post, memory usage is a key area of concern this year. aspect I ve been looking at lately is entity counts. Anything that gets networked in a server is an entity, so every tree, building block,, vehicle, etc. What might seem counterintuitive is that many Items in your inventory are entities, specifically an entity we call a Planner. This is the blue sheet your visually equips when they are deploying something eg. a sleeping bag. Any Item that can be deployed in your inventory will have a corresponding Planner entity. This entity is created when the item is created, and will exist on the server typically in the players hands or at the world origin if they are in a container until that item is used or destroyed. We need this entity as it handles all the logistics of spawning the deployed version of the item. To illustrate how many entities this creates we looked a list of entities on Facepunch towards the end of the November wipe last year. Out of entities, of them were Planners and are the largest count of entity the next largest was Walls at. Since Planners are technically only needed when the has the item equipped on their belt, this is a big waste of memory and processing time as well as needlessly bloating server save files. This month we ve rolled out a change that will only spawn a Planner for these Items once the Item is in a players inventory, then delete the entity when it is moved back into an inventory. This should dramatically cut down on the number of entities taking up memory for no real reason. We applied this change to Syringes and Bandages, specifically because these item types don t need an Entity if they aren t in the players inventory and are often stored in large quantities and respectively in the above sample. Syringes in particular have been a performance bottleneck for the Industrial system due to the need to create and destroy an Entity every time the item is moved, so this change should have flow on server performance improvements there as well. We think this change should reduce entity counts on the server by roughly but we ll be monitoring the results over time. INDUSTRIAL PERFORMANCE We received reports from several servers this month with Industrial performance issues. After investigating we found some extremely complex conveyor systems moving large amounts of Syringes as the culprit. The above to Entity counts will largely solve the issue, but I ve a convar to better handle time budgeting in these situations. While the Industrial system is time budgeted per frame eg. Only process three conveyors per frame it struggled if conveyor took an excessive amount of time eg. conveyor takes the allocated budget. This convar will allow the conveyor system to stop half way through a transfer if it is taking too long. Crucially it will then resume the transfer from where it left off on the next tick, so the final results should be the same, they may just take longer in real time. From the players perspective, this may result in conveyors splitting things in unintuitive ways eg. a conveyor splitting into three boxes might do on the first tick, then the last on the last tick but it should eventually produce the same result. Therefore we d recommend turning this on selectively if a server is experiencing Industrial performance issues. As well as this convar some general performance optimisations were made, so things should be a little faster across the board in the Industrial system. MEMORY OPTIMIZATIONS Despite having some guards in place, asset memory can easily run ouf of control. We keep adding awesome content and, unfortunately, it keeps increasing our memory footprint. In order to be able to sustain this rate of content expansion, memory usage has to be low and stable, regardless of world complexity. Until we can implement more aggressive and effective streaming, every once in a while we have to sit down and look at what we missed and make the necessary corrections. On this we nuked almost GB of memory usage in shader assets, plus a few hundred MB on textures and meshes. This is a bit of a soft start, in regards to textures and meshes, but we expect to reduce memory usge by a few more gigabytes in the coming months. We do care about memory and performance, and we actively working on it. This is just the first stage of many that will target not only improve memory usage but frame rate. IMPROVED TEXTURE QUALITY Modern universally depend on asset compression to maximize the efficient utilization of available system memory. To justify the efforts invested in compression, developers often turn to lossy techniques, which, particularly in the realm of textures, frequently lead to a compromise in image quality. was long overdue for a texture quality review. Below is a before and after. The improvement in detail and color fidelity can be striking in some cases right. This is an ugly texture but it a good example of how compression can ruin a high frequency image. Regions of pixels get merged together and color shifts slightly left. Texture compression was being used quite aggressively and, after tweaking some settings, we were able to significantly improve image quality without sacrificing memory. In the end, because a lot of textures had untapped potential for savings, we actually ended up saving runtime memory, at the cost of disk space, while still improving overall image quality. MARKERS WITH NV GOGGLES These were quite while wearing NV Goggles, especially near the screen edges, where they would sometimes float above seemingly nothing. This has now been fixed. IMPROVED VEHICLE BEHAVIOR Doors and Gates have been cancelling their animation when hitting a vehicle since Modular Cars were introduced, however that would sometimes lead to cases where the animation cancelling would crush vehicles if they hit the from the opposite side. This has been improved this month and colliding with an animated in the direction that it is moving will no longer cause the animation to cancel. This should lead to less cars getting crushed.

Performance? Performance is always an ongoing process. We constantly adding and improving features monthly, often hidden in changelogs. There is no magic button to increase performance. Instead, it is a slow process of small gains. Our immediate attention is on bringing memory usage down, which can provide a more stable and consistent FPS experience for some users. In short, the Nexus system allows us to cluster servers together and enable players to travel from server to server to server using flight and boats, effectively linking an unlimited amount of servers, creating an environment where you can interact with tens of thousands, if not hundreds of thousands of players and explore multiple maps without the need to move servers permanently. Nexus opens many doors to us, for example, dedicated arctic maps and maps with advanced AI and resource maps but with a dangerous environment. HAPIS ISLAND Continuing with the theme of throwbacks to celebrate Birthday, you asked, we listened, Hapis Island is back again! This map version is and based on the version. If there thing the community does lack, it is passion. We plan to host Hapis Island until March. We hosting servers of Hapis Island across different regions. These can be found in the official server list by searching Hapis US EU IMPROVED RAGDOLL BEHAVIOUR ragdolls the floppy state a body enters after being killed have been revamped this month. They can now collide with all vehicles in the trains, cars, boats, helicopters etc, where previously they simply fell through. Issues with ragdolls stretching out unnaturally have been eliminated. If you ever saw a corpse where the interaction was lined up with the visible ragdoll, that fixed too. Old Behaviour When a died, a corpse entity used to spawn that was basically just a collider, which was physically simulated on the server. The position of that corpse would sync with every client. On the client side, a separate ragdoll object would spawn, that was a whole visible person with a full set of physically simulated limbs. That ragdoll was attached to the corpse basically by a tight spring. The corpse object controlled the actual loot interaction. Essentially the intention was Let the client do the work of simulating a whole body. We do care how their arms and legs are positioned, on the server. If it different between clients, do care. Keep the loot interaction consistent between clients by simulating just that part on the server. Keep the ragdoll and the corpse together with the spring. In reality, things were not perfect If a died somewhere the top of a wall, the corpse might fall down but not the ragdoll, or vice versa. Since the collision setup was quite different between corpse and ragdoll only the pelvis area matched this was relatively common. The result would be a mismatched position between corpse and ragdoll, sometimes putting the interaction in a strange place. The ragdoll joints did not working with the pelvis position data that was coming from the server. If movement was sudden, rather than just ending up in the wrong place, the ragdoll would sometimes stretch out unnaturally. If a ragdoll was on a moving vehicle, things were especially bad, to the point that we could enable ragdoll collision with vehicles at all. Things would happen a ragdoll dangling under a scrap heli because it had fallen out but the corpse had. This was exacerbated by the fact that the ragdoll physics simulation did work well with the fact that the vehicle was being moved on the server, rather than simulating on the client the ragdoll was. Although the physics did work, they acted the surface had zero friction, so the ragdoll would tend to slide around while the corpse wanted to stay put and the spring kept trying keep them together. Behaviour My first instinct for the simplest fix was to try just locking the ragdoll to the corpse, rather than using a spring. That would them to stay together. Unfortunately locking the pelvis to a position that was coming from the server, whilst simulating all the connected joints on the client, made the physics system very unhappy. Trying Unity tricks using versus, projection on or off, more solver iterations etc did help. The limbs would want to stay where they were while the pelvis pulled them around, and you just end up with a horrifying ragdoll instead of that was simply in the wrong place. Plus the limbs still had some of the old problems, the issue. The pelvis did always simulate well for a full body, since it did have any of the connected, so it try to places the full body did want to. The spring allowed for that kind of leeway, but a fixed connection did. So support was going to require either writing a custom physics solution for simulating the limbs on the client plus making something better for the pelvis simulation on the server side, or moving the whole ragdoll simulation to the server. Ultimately the custom physics solution was going to require most of the same work that a fully ragdoll was, on top of being difficult to code on my own in a way that came out superior to what Unity has already managed with employees. So ragdolls was the winner. The ragdolls work this A corpse spawns on the server, and that corpse is a fully simulated ragdoll with limbs etc. The base position of that corpse syncs to the client it did before, but now the limbs sync, in an efficient way that packed into a couple of integers. The client no longer has a ragdoll object that separate from the corpse. The corpse is the ragdoll, and it simulated only on the server. That basically eliminates all the problems at once, apart from the performance cost on the server of simulating more than it did before. To handle that, I made sure that ragdolls stop simulating as soon as they settled down, including when they on a moving vehicle. Overall the performance cost on the server is low, and behaviour is much improved. Reverting If anything does wrong, there is a console command that can be set true or false. It now true by default, but setting it to false will immediately revert to the old system. ABOVE AND BELOW RAIL LINKING This month we are finally connecting the rail network with the underground. While playing on servers with a world size of at least, you will find or rail tunnels allowing you to seamlessly travel between the underground and networks. To do it, simply take a train inside of the tunnels, drive it down a short slope and you will be inside the underground network. All wagon types are fully compatible with both networks regardless of their length allowing for gameplay opportunities. To top it off, we made some visual tweaks to the network that fix light leaking issues in small areas the stairwells, as well as made some other minor tweaks and fixes. UNDERGROUND TRAIN SIGNALS For a while now we had signal lights in the underground train tunnels, but they were always off. They now fully functional and can be used to see what up ahead. A green light means the block is clear. A red light means the block has something in it a train or a barricade. A yellow light means the next block has something in it, so you can get prepared. A block is the section between train signals. If there no next signal, it the rest of the track, either to the end of the line or the next if it further than that to the end of the line. TURRET INTERFACING A common complaint we have been hearing for a very long time as the and abuse of turrets. To combat this we Turret Interference Basically this means that only a certain amount of turrets can be active in any particular area. subsequently activated turrets will emit a blue electrical glow and fail to acquire any targets. There is no hard limit on the number of turrets you can deploy, only a limit on the number of turrets to be activated at any time within. For example, you may choose to enable of your outdoor turrets but keep your indoor turrets disabled or you can set up smart circuits to detect players and power up turrets when needed. Hopefully this addresses some of the concerns we been hearing regarding this issue, and we plan to iterate and improve, we be watching the feedback. ATTACK HELICOPTER The Attack Helicopter is now available to purchase from the Air Wolf at Bandit Camp for scrap. Gunner The main special feature of this helicopter is the gunner seat. On the front is a turret similar to the deployable autoturret, where you can equip a gun and ammo. At the side pods, rockets can be loaded in HV and incendiary type only. The gunner can then aim and shoot both of these while a pilot flies the heli. Simply interact with the gunner monitor and start blasting! will shoot the turret and launches rockets. If the gunner has flares ready in his or her inventory belt, those can be held and manually thrown to deflect any oncoming homing rockets from the homing rocket launcher this is a feature for passengers in all helicopter types, not just the attack helicopter. Pilot The pilot is the driver, but can fire rockets left mouse button by default, albeit without the handy guide that the gunner gets. Standard flares can be loaded into the rocket storage area along with rockets, and the pilot can fire them out right mouse button. The attack helicopter is fast and powerful when armed, but it was still be taken down with a rocket. HOMING MISSILE LAUNCHER The Homing Missile Launcher is a craftable addition to your armoury that allows you to more efficiently fight flying targets while out and about. To get started simply load a Homing Missile into the Launcher and start aiming at a flying target. You ll notice a bar will start filling in. Once locked on you can fire, but be sure to keep aiming at the target or the missile will fly off course. Changing weapon or reloading will disrupt the targeting. From a pilot perspective, there are a few tools at your disposal to evade these threats. You will hear a warning lock audio indicator in every helicopter when a missile is fired at you. The simplest tactic is just taking evasive manoeuvres the missile lock requires a direct line of sight so getting something solid between you and the launcher should keep you safe. If that s not possible, flares are your next best bet. Any passenger can throw Flares to disrupt any incoming missiles. The Attack Helicopter has a dedicated Flare button that can launch flares via the secondary attack button RMB by default. The NPC piloted Patrol Helicopter has been upgraded with Flare functionality, it will automatically fire Flares when a missile is launched at it. The Homing Missile Launcher requires a Workbench Level and can be crafted for HQM, Metal Pipes, Tech Trash and CCTV Camera. Homing Missiles require a Workbench Level, and missiles can be crafted for Metal Pipes, Gun Powder and Tech Trash. PARACHUTES The parachute is a craftable item that allows you to slow your fall from great heights, as well as travel silently over long distances. Once you ve acquired, you will need to equip it in the dedicated backpack slot on your character s clothing bar. Once equipped you ll be able to press Space while falling through the air to deploy the parachute, slowing your descent and allowing you to manoeuvre your way through the sky. Your movement keys can help you manoeuvre while in, allowing you to tilt forwards to fly faster, back to slow down and left and right to turn. You can use weapons while flying, but doing so will prevent you from steering. Simply holster your weapon again to regain steering controls. Your flight can end either via you hitting something solid or cutting your lines with the Dismount key. After your flight an unpacked version of the parachute will drop in front of you, to use the parachute again you ll need to hold the pickup key for seconds to pick it up again. Each use will lower the condition of your parachute by and a parachute will become harder to control as it loses condition. A damaged parachute will fall faster and fly forwards slower. At extreme damage levels you could still take fall damage when landing the parachute. If you hit something solid you can take damage based on your speed, up to at top speeds. The additional slot in your inventory has been to the locker interface so you can parachutes with loadout kits. Parachutes are a special type of clothing that can be equipped alongside clothing Hazmats. Parachutes can be targeted by SAM sites, Auto Turrets and players on the ground while in. You can craft Parachutes at a Tier Workbench for Tarps, Sewing Kits and Cloth. ARMORED HOT HAIR BALLOON The hot air balloon can now be upgraded with a armor upgrade. Equipping the armor will boost the overall health of the balloon whilst providing additional cover and protection. The armor upgrade can be purchased at the Bandit Camp vehicle parts vendor. NETWORKED BASES You normally only see bases away. Get ready this feature cranks up the view distance of structures up to away! In the past, SAM sites could appear out of nowhere, only becoming visible after the missiles are headed your way. You should now be able to spot SAM sites enemy bases long before you come in range! This does just benefit you in the air. While on the ground you can scout roof camping towers big bases before you are in danger. You will notice the world feels much alive with evidence of activity all around you. I know you thinking Wo this cause performance issues?. Well, turns out the rendering system is significantly more efficient than unity normal. The majority of computation is on the GPU which allows us to keep performance parity while rendering the amount of bases. This sets the stage for additional performance improvements in the future. This feature is currently disabled by default as it required a lot of. Look for Rendering in the option menu to enable it. WEAPON RACKS The Weapons Rack Pack is now available from the item. Weapon racks introduce a quick, versatile and functional weapon and tool storage solution. With a Weapon Rack, you can efficiently organize, and display your tools and weapons a true survivor. The weapons rack pack lets the craft three different sized weapon racks and a single floor storage solution. If you missed last month community blog, check out the weapons rack. SLEEPING BAG LIMITS This month we ve decided to limit the maximum number of respawn options to per. This is a big change and not we make lightly, so we thought it would be a good idea to explain our thinking. While this is an inconvenience to certain playstyles, we believe adapting to this change will lead to a healthier and more interesting. Back in October we revised the death screen, unintentionally making it trivial to manage a large number of bags. This led to situations where players could respawn rapidly and rejoin fights in ways that work against the goal of death being meaningful in. Ultimately we want placing respawn points to be an interesting decision rather than something done as often as possible. We explored alternatives such as adjusting the respawn radius on bags or grid based approaches. Unfortunately this was simple to bypass and too complicated to communicate to players. Increasing the cost of wouldn t have solved the issue as large groups could easily overcome any additional resource requirements. To help manage respawn options we have made them visible on the map while alive. We the ability to unclaim bags you are using anymore. There is a toggle on the right side of the map below the layer controls to hide bags while alive. There are multiple ways to see how many you have placed a count on the icon as well as a notification after you place a. To prevent malicious behavior such as gifting bags to other players and filling up their quota you will find a Bag Gifting option in the options menu. This will allow you to limit who can assign a bag to you. The choices are Anyone default option teammates friendly in contact system Disabled nobody allowed Server owners can change the maximum bags per server with the convar. If you would to disable it for your server, set it to. We will keep an eye on this change over the coming months and make as required. BUILD UPGRADE EFFECT To say that our building upgrade effect was dated would be an understatement. I do think it has been adjusted since its inception. I taken some time to improve the effect, and bring it in to this decade. When you upgrade a building block, you will see it constructed piece by piece over the course of second. Short demonstration here. Keep in mind that this is a effect and the upgrade still happens immediately on the server. You can disable this effect in the options menu. In the future, we may expand this effect into a feature, so that very large deployables, such as watchtowers do just appear in frame but rather will need to be built over time. Maximum is unchanged from last month, it will stop moving items if there is greater than the amount provided in the output container. Buffer is the old minimum behaviour, and will only move items in predetermined buffer sizes. For example, if you set Buffer to wood and you have wood in the container, will be moved. With these tools you can move items around your base as well as craft items automatically without you needing to lift a finger. Storage Adaptor The Storage Adaptor is the starting point for most of your Industrial plans simply attach an adaptor to an existing storage entity to make that entity compatible with your Industrial systems. The adaptor does not require power. Some entities have more than slot that a storage adaptor can be attached to for ease of placement. Typically the storage adaptor can use all inventory slots on it attached storage for, although there are some exceptions When attached to a furnace the Input will insert items into the item slots while the output will remove items from the output slots When attached to a locker the storage adaptor will only access partition, to access all partitions you need to place three storage adaptors The storage adaptor is compatible with Tool Cupboard Large Wooden Box Small Wooden Box Small Furnace Large Furnace Refinery Electric Furnace Locker Fridge Drop box Vending Machine Industrial Conveyor The Conveyor is responsible for moving items from entity to another, generally via Storage Adaptors. Once powered and turned on the conveyor will look for items in containers connected to its inputs and then divide those items amongst its outputs. By default a Conveyor will move any item it can find, but you can assign a filter to have more precise control over exactly what items you moving. Each Conveyor filter can have up to items or categories. When a filter is assigned the Conveyor will only transfer items that pass those conditions. You can assign values to each item in a filter to control quantities, by setting the Maximum amount do send resources if the target container has over of that resource already and Minimum amount only send resources in a minimum batch of size. You find a Filter Pass and Filter Fail electrical passthrough, these will activate based on the current state of the conveyor allowing you to control other parts of the Industrial network based on what items are being moved around. Pipe Tool The Pipe Tool is how you connect industrial entities if you used the Wire or Hose tool before you be right at home. Pipes come in colours to help identify what going where. Same distance rules apply here except that the anchor points need to be a small distance apart from another and that pipes can not through building blocks or Vending Machines. In the case of a splitter connected to the output of a Conveyor, the Conveyor will spread its resources across all of its connections eg. a Conveyor connected to a splitter which connects to three boxes that wants to send wood will send wood to each box. Simply insert the blueprint of your choice in the blueprint slot, insert the required materials, connect some power and turn it on to start producing items.
