Future Next steps are to expand to gameplay metrics. Technically we already have some gameplay stats but they are very limited total wood gathered, total kills, etc. Better gameplay metrics will give us the ability to drill down to specific information such as most popular weapon each day of a wipe win ratio of different weapon deaths per size of hourly loot per monuments least used items WATER IO SERVER IMPROVEMENTS We been aware of some server performance degradation with large scale farms and Water Catcher networks for a while and we made some improvements this month to hopefully improve the situation. The primary performance issue at here is the amount of processing required when an entity in an IO chain switches on or off. Under normal circumstances this does happen that often but water containers are considered On when they have water and Off when they are empty. When a chain of Water Catchers are connected and sending water down a chain each container will turn on when it receives the water and then turn off as it passes the water to its next container. Water transferring is quite quick and responsive, this results in rapid sequences of entities turning on and off repeatedly which sends a lot of network updates to any clients in range and involves a lot of largely useless IO processing as the network state so rapidly. To solve these issues water will now take seconds to start draining once it inserted into a container. This means that when water travels through multiple containers each container in the sequence will build up a buffer usually water in each container. This allows the same water flow as before but mostly prevents the containers rapidly turning. The result is that a small sequence of full barrels connected to each other powering a sprinkler used to be sending network updates every few seconds will no longer send any updates at all while the system is active, only a few updates when the system runs out of water. This should improve performance primarily on the server but receiving less network traffic will help client performance as well. We modified the behaviour of Water Catchers, when a Water Catcher is going to generate some water, it will now deposit its water as far down the chain as possible. This means that if you have Water Catchers connected to a Water Barrel, the catchers will actually never receive water at all, instead the water will be deposited directly into the barrel. In a benchmark of water catchers connected to each other, we found that the server IO would become unresponsive after several minutes of gameplay as the system became overloaded with water transfer processing. With the above server IO performance remains instantaneous even if we artificially limit the servers frame rate. There is a optional server convar that modifies the draining behaviour to leave unit of water behind in a liquid container that drains into another container. This keeps the container in its On state permanently and further helps performance. Since this is a change in functionality it is disabled by default, if your server is still experiencing IO performance issues due to water entities turning this on may improve performance. HAPIS RETIREMENT Today we permanently retiring Hapis Island map. Hapis Island was first introduced in April by Petur, inspired by the original legacy map. Over the years, Hapis has gone through countless revisions to where it is at today. Why Retire Hapis? We a small development with no dedicated staff focusing on map design and creation, our mapping attention is focused on procedural maps. Hapis has continuously been developed on the sidelines as a project with any free time Petur has. Free time is harder to find nowadays as we focus more on larger, features with a higher level of polish. Hapis Island needs a lot of attention requiring hundreds of work hours to be polished and kept fresh, which we ca currently give it. Hapis Island is missing many key features we over the past couple of years, zip lines, subways, monuments and rail systems, to name a few. When Hapis can support newer features it often takes an extra month, or few for the features to be introduced to Hapis, leaving players waiting and disappointed, some features, such as the rail systems Hapis ca currently support due to a lack of internal tools. This is the end for static maps on Facepunch servers, we be working with the custom map community to fill this void over the coming weeks and months. UNITY UPGRADE We have upgraded the client engine to Unity version earlier this month. Initially there have been a number of issues from the upgrade, but we gone through and addressed all the major ones with several small patches. This version of Unity should open up possibilities for both performance and visual improvements that we hoping to introduce over the coming months. A big is Unity Burst compiler that will help us transition existing code in the Jobs system to a higher performance version of it. Unfortunately the upgrade introduced a bug in fullscreen exclusive mode that caused a significant performance degradation compared to borderless fullscreen mode. Due to this we had to retire fullscreen exclusive mode. If you encountering issues that seem related to this, please contact our support to figure out a workaround for your specific setup. The server build of the will remain on for this month while we continue testing the engine version to make sure the server build is stable enough for a wide release. More on that hopefully next month. MULTITHREADED NETWORK TESTING We been working on a major networking performance improvement called multithreaded networking. This will apply to both the client and the server, but naturally it will have a significantly higher impact on the server. Due to the nature of the change we wanted to make sure it working as intended before enabling it by default, so we first going to start testing it on select official servers this month before hopefully enabling it by default on all servers next month. If you want to start testing it before then, simply add the startup parameter to your server or client. Please note that this is a highly experimental feature that may cause significant problems when enabled. SERVER QUERY PORT SHARING RETIREMENT As announced in the November and December devblogs, we are working on a number of networking improvements that require us to retire server query port sharing. Because of this, we have requested that all server owners that are still using this feature their server startup parameters to use a query port that is separate from the port. We have decided to pull the trigger and finally retire query port sharing this month. If you a server owner who still has updated their server startup parameters, please make sure to do so immediately.

SEPARATE NETWORK GROUPS FOR TUNNELS For some background, network groups are what servers use to figure out which entities to network to players. It basically divides the world up into chunks and tracks which entities are within each chunk. This way the server just needs to network the few chunks around each. Previously the world was divided up into a dimensional grid of chunks, and that worked great for a long time, but then we the underground tunnels. Using dimensional network groups means the tunnels would network to players up on the surface, and players in the tunnel are being networked things from the surface, which is great because they ca see any of that so it just wasted work. I updated the network group system this month to add support for vertical layers. So now, instead of a just a single dimensional grid, it essentially stacks multiple dimensional grids on top of each other and uses entity altitude to figure out which layer it belongs on. Tunnel entities will no longer network to the surface, and the surface will no longer network to players in the tunnels. We have found that this can save up to of frametime on the surface by not networking tunnel NPCs to the client. QUALITY OF LIFE Swap Attachments Swap Attachments more easily by right clicking or click and dragging to attachment slots Get bags while dead Death screen will now if you are assigned a bag while already dead Cap Menu FPS to setting in Options menu, prevents high framerates HLOD For the past few months I been working on a system to improve how we render monuments at a distance while maintaining or improving the current performance. It uses a technique called HLOD Hierarchical Level of Detail and involves baking the monument as it should be seen at a distance down into a single mesh. A key requirement was to make sure this did add any extra work for our environment artists, this process is almost entirely automated. The final performance improvements were minimal, but the increased visual fidelity at a distance still seemed worthwhile to ship. You should notice more geometry and detail, as well as entire monuments that will now be visible when they were before. Proton Support You know, we switched to EAC platform with the intention of providing support for the Deck, and so far we have done that. So when is it coming? Well, short answer is we do know. We do know if it is. When we discontinued linux support in, of the core reasons was how the cheating community was exploiting the Linux platform. That not to say that cheating was super widespread on Linux, but it was safer for cheat developers. And that not good in a where a cheater can ruin weeks of hard work. Enabling proton support would mean we asking the EAC to provide support for a whole other platform, which we fear would reduce their ability to support Windows our main platform. We do know whether we should enable platform at the disadvantage of another. The thing we do want to do is to enable Proton support to only discontinue it months later. We do want to encourage players to spend their money on a Deck to and then be in a position where we want to take that ability away. For now, we still weighing up the risks and will continue to explore options with EAC. Do expect to see Proton support in the near future, but we hope to have it enabled someday. TRAINYARD UNLOADING TOWER The rail network is now connected up to the Trainyard area, and the Trainyard has a tower that can unload certain types of train wagons. Railway sidings will now sometimes spawn unloadable wagons in several varieties Ore wagons filled with sulfur, iron, or charcoal Fuel tank wagons filled with low grade fuel Loot wagons that can be unloaded to reveal loot crates All of these can be hooked up to a train and taken to the unloading tower at Trainyard for unloading. You need a green keycard and a fuse to get full access, after which you can unload as many wagons as you. Ore and fuel into an output hopper and fuel tank respectively inside the tower. Loot wagons activate their crates when emptied so you can then out and loot them. The Work Cart train engine has been reduced in power, and is now only able to pull a small amount of train cars at a time. The large Locomotive provides superior pulling power instead. FLASH BANG AND MOLOTOV COCKTAIL throwable items have been to the. The Molotov Cocktail is a powerful area denial weapon which slows movement and deals damage over time. It can be used to damage and destroy wooden structures. The Flashbang is a short fuse, low damage explosive which will blind and disorient anyone unfortunate enough to be in the blast radius and looking in it general direction. We hoping the addition of this tool reduces the benefit of corner camping and shakes up how room clearing is approached Both are available in the tech tree of the workbench. QOL Updated Wooden Signs The Wooden sign has been received a model Scrap Tea Buff Scrap Tea now yields more scrap and lasts longer Improved Cliff Collision A number of cliff colliders have been improved, making them easier to climb Invalid Projectiles when Mounted Fixed a long standing bug causing invalid projectiles when mounted to vehicles CUBEMAP AMBIENT LIGHT The lighting in has been quite outdated for a long time. The primary reason for this have been our highly dynamic environments that prevent us from using any sort of statically baked lighting data. This resulted in flat and boring looking environments, particularly in areas that were receiving any direct light. To combat this, I finally implemented our own ambient lighting model that uses a blurred version of our existing reflection data, which is already completely dynamic. The lighting model is of course enabled for everybody, but it comes with a few customization options. The previous World Reflections quality setting has been replaced with toggles in the Experimental graphics options Advanced interior lighting, which when enabled includes bases in the lighting model, and advanced forest lighting, does the same for trees. PERFORMANCE WORK I spent a good part of the month looking for client performance optimisations with varying levels of success. I a variety of unnecessary components from all humanoid NPCs Scientist, dwellers, shopkeepers, etc. This should reduce the performance hit when entering network range of an NPC. I unnecessary components from various static entities that are placed in monuments think vending machines, chairs, etc. This should make them spawn faster when entering network range. I made some to our LOD system to more aggressively disable shadows in places where it will make no visual difference. This includes any static prop that is considered small and parts of the body clothing, eyebrows, teeth, etc. These should reduce the number of shadow casting meshes when more than a couple of meters away from a prop or. Both of these can be disabled by the and convars but they will be enabled by default this month. Underground props that are part of the train tunnels are now more aggressively culled if you are in a train tunnel. Made more potential optimisations to the performance drop when hitting a node. This is mostly due to the UI animating in the bottom right of the screen and a lot of the performance cost is happening outside of our control. I still made a few improvements that should hopefully improve it but there is still a mild performance drop. MONUMENT LIGHTING LIGHT SWITCHES I spent some time over the past few weeks adding lights to a bunch of our older monuments. Now nearly all of them should be covered this pass, aside from a few monuments that are meant to be completely abandoned and should remain dark. This includes monuments such as Harbors, Power Plant and the Trainyard. In addition, you will find that the monuments covered by the lighting pass will now feature light switches that you can use to toggle the lights on and off. You can now decide whether you want the comfort of seeing clearly in the dark at a risk of being seen by other players, turn the lights off for your safety while exploring, or use them to ambush unsuspecting players. ADS IMPROVEMENTS We recently saw a video from hJune which helped us identify a long standing issue with the aiming code. Basically, if you when into ADS mode shortly after running, the weapon bob was not immediately disabled, and instead took far too long to gradually dissipate. This resulted in a disparity between the weapon sight and the true aim direction, meaning you were not actually aiming at your target for the first several shots. This has been fixed and aiming down the sight should feel a lot more responsive and snappy. CONTENT REPORTING Thanks to everyone for taking the time to report content last month, we were able to clear a lot of content on official servers as a result. To help us quickly act on your reports, I made a Slack tool this month that allows us to remove any reported content directly from Slack, without having to load the up. If server owners are looking for similar functionality we can recommend the Discord Sign Logger plugin by MJSU. Please keep sending your reports in! Combat Balance Since the release of the Combat, we monitored feedback and overall we happy with the state of the gunplay in. We will continue to listen, and make adjustments when needed. The fuse time on the grenade has been decreased by to. During combat testing we felt that grenades were a bit too easy to evade under most circumstances. Maybe some day we will allow players to cook grenades but right now that seems it would be a bit too cheap of a tactic. The has had it role changed so it feels more a superior SAR. Its fire rate has been increased and recoil modified. We noticed that shotgun slugs were very underused so we have reduced the damage falloff so that shotgun users can opt to utilize them in mid range combat and stand a chance. Lastly, we fixed a long standing issue with viewmodels where the first shot shortly after ADSing would the animation and obscure the screen with the view model. All weapons should feel much more snappy now. It will now queue up the loading of assets so they can continue being from disk while the main thread spawns all of the world prefabs, which means better utilization of hardware. This applies to the dedicated server so server owners may see some improvement with boot times. Ultimately, being good at first person shooters and having the drop on someone was good enough. If the other person had thousands of hours of training their aim you stood very little chance. This was fun for people who could spend thousands of hours training their aim, or morally bankrupt individuals who would choose to use scripts to gain an advantage. This was not fun for of the population, and it time for a change. Instead of pattern based recoil, we now implement a gradient based aim drift and inaccuracy for automatic weapons. That is to say, the longer you hold down the trigger, the more inaccurate the weapon becomes. It still takes skill to try and keep it centered on the target, but it is not the same with each burst. We updated aimcone inaccuracy of bullets relative to where you are aiming to use a weighted system, so that roughly of the shots will land in the center. This means that automatic fire at a long range effectively decreases DPS. This encourages players to use the right weapons in the right situations and to improve their tactics and burst discipline. There should be less beaming going on. What this has done is compressed the skill ceiling, and we think this is a good thing. Perfectly replicated recoil meant that mouse scripts could be abused to put rounds on target at, every time. In addition to the aforementioned recoil, we went through and modernized some other elements of the person shooter experience. Sounds The most immediately noticeable change is the sound effects of most of the guns have been updated. This might take some getting used to but the quality has improved significantly. View models The View Models have had their dynamic animations updated. You notice the walking bob is much improved, as is the sway when looking. It a small change but helps to bring things into this decade. View Models have a crisper punch back when firing, and they animate the main camera during reloads to emphasize the hand actions. We head bob which is active when sprinting, it a small touch but adds to the experience. You can turn this off in the options. All of these elements combined gives the weapons in a much cleaner and modern feeling. Hit punch directional markers We felt that there were some issues knowing where you were taking damage from, with large splotches of blood covering most of the screen during high damage encounters. We changed this so that you now receive a smaller semicircle blood splat indicating the direction you took damage from, and a small amount of Screen Shake. Please note that silenced shots will not produce a damage indicator on the victims HUD. Hit cross We a visual hit indicator to accompany the sound you all familiar with. Upon landing a successful hit onto another or AI you now notice a hit marker cross briefly appearing. Crosshair years ago in legacy, people would tie dental floss to the top and sides of their monitor to create a crosshair in the center. Now everyone can simply enable on their monitor or using third party software. Because of this we decided to add a crosshair to the natively. The crosshair will give you a rough idea of your accuracy based on the weapon you are holding and your stance. We be looking at crosshair customization options in the future, as well as specific crosshairs for different weapon types, etc. The crosshair can be disabled within the options menu if you hate it and third party crosshairs are allowed to be used. As always, this is a work in progress, We going to review all the feedback and continue to make adjustments until we get this right. Everything is subject to change. Handmade LMG The handmade light machine gun is a tier craftable weapon, with high damage, a high rate of fire, and low accuracy but great at suppressing fire. Crafting cost HQM, rifle body, metal springs and gears. Extended magazine The extended magazine is a tier weapon attachment which can be attached to most guns, providing an additional ammo capacity. Crafting cost high quality metal. Mixing Table Ammo Hate standing around crafting ammo? You can now craft basic ammo types from the mixing table. Players are still required to have the ammo blueprint unlocked. If your vehicle still feels difficult to control, please use the options menu Vehicle sensitivity slider or the console command whatever value you want to adjust to your liking. Trains We wanted to get some trains onto the rails this month. We have some more train content in the works, but for this initial release we mostly reusing existing assets in order to provide something to try out until that content is ready. The Work Cart closely resembles the underground, but now has coupling points at each end that can connect to other train cars. The bogies known as trucks the wheel assemblies have been updated to rotate with the track more realistically. We taken some static train wagon models that we had and made them functional. These do actually do anything special yet, but they spawn along with Work Carts on the rail sidings and they can be shunted around. The Work Cart train engines take low grade fuel as usual. Their target speeds at throttle are constant, but their acceleration and pulling ability are affected by gravity and how many couples wagons they pulling as you expect. If your long train ca make it up a hill, it possible to use multiple Work Carts in a coupled setup for more power. Coupling happens automatically when wagons collide at a low to moderate speed. High speed collisions will not couple, and may take damage instead. Uncoupling is manual simply interact with the coupling point. Rail Network Branch Lines The rail network has received secondary lines that branch off the main line and merge back onto it. This all happens entirely procedurally with no need for predetermined prefabs aside from the rail mesh itself, which results in a very flexible system that can cover a wide range of use cases as we expand the rail network in the future. For now, these branch lines are just where the trains are spawning. We will see how things work out and from there. Rail and road foliage improvements The foliage bushes spawning next to rails and roads have received some optimizations to eliminate their overhead as you move around the world. They now spawn in larger clusters with varying coverage, resulting in some dense areas and some open areas, which allowed us to reduce their total count as a performance improvement without having it affect the visuals too much. Zipline Improvements Ziplines seemed to be well used last month, but there were too many cases of ziplines failing to connect, leading to zipline platforms with no connections. I improved the procedural generation process this month in a few different ways. Ziplines are now better at routing around obstacles, allowing ziplines to via separate before arriving at their destination. I zipline arrival points at Sewer Branch, Stables, Lighthouse and Dome. All of these combined have improved the number of ziplines on procedural maps by about. Death screen Improvements The death screen has been improved this month with many NPC getting custom icons and proper translations. We improved how we show your death information if you suicide while downed. Previously doing this would result in the death screen showing your death as a suicide, preventing you from seeing the name and weapon of your attacker. This is now fixed and you will see the last attack details even if you suicide while downed. Client Performance Client performance was identified as a growing issue last month so we all put some time aside to try and improve performance this month. We made good progress in some key areas Fixed a regression introduced last month that was generating a lot of garbage and causing stutters. This was deemed high enough priority that we it in a hotfix early in the month. Identified a bug that was preventing lasers and some other heavy systems from budgeting their performance correctly This was affecting server performance. Significantly reduced network traffic from planters and plants getting watered by sprinklers. Performance is always a high priority for us and we got more improvements being worked on for future updates. Thank you to Ailtop,, and Mughisi for the contributions. We have some more improvements to this system in the works, specifically to improve rendering and network performance on rapidly updated UI displays. To access the zipline you need to climb to the top of the platforms that are attached to some powerlines. You can speed up on the line by holding forward and jump off at anytime with the jump key just be careful of the drop!. This months brings a monument, the Arctic Research Base, snowmobiles, polar bears, AI, spray can item, QOL and much more! Arctic Research Base In this month, a monument has been. The Arctic Research Base will spawn exclusively in the arctic biome. Those who are not afraid of the cold winds and frigid temperatures will be able to explore various lab modules and buildings scattered around the base. You will find there a bunch of loot to scavenge, or take a little break to warm yourself next to an electric heater. But most importantly, the Arctic Research Base will spawn snowmobiles. Keep in mind, however, that scientists wo appreciate your presence and will shoot you on sight. Snowmobiles We a vehicle that only available through a puzzle at the Arctic Base Snowmobiles. Snowmobiles take fuel and have a small storage container on the back. They fast on snow and sand and slow everywhere else. They drive smoothly even over rough terrain but take some skill to control well. When you find in an Arctic Base, it have fuel ready to. A passenger can sit on the back and face any direction, allowing them to shoot to the sides or even directly behind. POLAR BEARS You now be encountering the polar bear in the arctic biome. The polar bear is the strongest and most hostile animal in the world but yields extra resources when harvested compared to its bear cousin. The regular bear will no longer be spawning in the arctic and receive slight health and hostile reduction. AI We the ability for scientists to use medical items to heal themselves. Scientists have a chance of spawning with the ability. We initially enabled this at the arctic research station and we add it to other areas of the soon. We made some timing, balance and movement tweaks to the scientist AI. Spraycan The Spraycan is a default tool that can be crafted for metal fragments that allows you to reskin items that have been deployed in the world. Instead of having to pick up items and use a Repair Bench, you can simply use RMB while holding a Spraycan to open up the skin options and select a skin. You may have seen some further spray functionality on the Staging branch this month, however these features had some issues so we had to delay them for a future. Whilst attempting to confirm this, we noticed that the framerate would predictably dip significantly for no apparent reason, then recover. The higher your base framerate was, the more severe these dips would appear to be. November will give players a reason to watch the skies, because after today those skies might be filled with up to a dozen rockets screaming toward your base face. The November adds military bases to the map, and each base has a vehicle that can be used to rain death and destruction onto a specifically targeted area a

DESERT MILITARY BASES We fully procedural Military bases containing the MLRS equipment this, these will be different on every server, every wipe. They are built from a pool of individual modules and fill different templates. Each has a few points of entry, regular loot with a sprinkle of oil and you will face some resistance from scientists as well. MLRS The Desert Military Base monuments each have a parked Multiple Launch Rocket System MLRS. This vehicle does move you wo be driving it around the map but it can be set up to fire rockets to any target. Except safe zones, naturally. These MLRS rockets can do significant damage to bases. They can be countered by SAM sites, but a full barrage of rockets will only be mostly repelled by SAM sites, and completely fought off by three. Using the MLRS. First you need to acquire an MLRS Aiming Module which can be found in locked hackable crates and to twelve MLRS rockets that are found in elite, APC and Attack helicopter crates.. Interact with the back of the MLRS and insert your rockets.. Get in the MLRS and open the Aiming Module slot, and insert your aiming module, which will activate the weapon systems.. Interact with the targeting screen and set your desired target. You can to move the map around, and click to place the target. If you set a marker on the main map view earlier, it show up here as a red marker, which should help with targeting bases. A red crosshair indicates where you want to aim. A white circle indicates where the MLRS will actually hit. These will usually match, but can differ if the MLRS is still moving its aim into position, or if there an obstacle in the way. The MLRS shoots high in the air, so mountains and so on wo usually be a problem, but the white circle will show you if they are. The target circle shows the total area that might be damaged by an MLRS attack not all rockets will hit the exact same spot, though there is a bias towards the centre of the circle. No damage will be done outside of the target circle area.. Press button to fire. The MLRS will shoot all the rockets you have loaded, and break down for minutes or whatever the brokenDownMinutes console variable is set to. This month brings the foundation of the mission system, huge amount of quality of life improvements, a camper vehicle module and much more! Missions Today we introducing the first iteration of a mission system to. You are now able to speak to various NPCs found around the world and receive a list of objectives you must complete in exchange for a reward. This first pass of missions are geared more towards players just getting started but the system is capable of much more. We will be expanding on this in the coming months to include PvP missions capture and hold, delivery, ambush and eventually even bounty hunting. You can find mission providers at most safe zones and their tasks vary, from catching fish or harvesting lumber to hunting sharks and uncovering hidden treasure. The mission system will be expanded upon over the coming months. We look forward to reading your feedback. Camper Module Take that long overdue vacation in the Camper module for your modular car. It s a slot module that includes seats that function as spawn points, overhead lockers, a bbq and a small box worth of storage. To mark a seat in the camper van as a respawn point simply sit in it, look down and use Make Bed to claim it. You will then be able to respawn directly into that seat regardless of its location, even while the car is moving! If another has claimed a seat, you have to clear their ownership before you can claim it as your own this will appear as an interaction option. The module requires a workbench, Metal Frags and Wood to craft. You ll find the locker above the seats, the barbecue to your side and the small storage box underneath the barbecue. Happy camping! General QOL Jarryd spent some time this month working through a backlog of quality of life improvements that we ve assembled internally. Thankfully all of you in the community had plenty more ideas so after a month of work the QOL list is now even longer than it was at the start. Thanks to everyone across Discord, Reddit and Twitter for suggesting ideas! If your suggestion wasn t implemented this month rest assured we ve taken plenty of notes for future work in this area. A lot of the are pretty scattershot and all around the see the changelog for more details, but some of the notable are below. Sign Painting The primary improvement for sign painting this month is being able to pick up signs and redeploy them without losing the painted content. You can now pick up signs, picture frames and neon signs with the hammer, inspect the painting in your inventory, trade it to others and redeploy it at will. The sign painting interface has had some improvements, including being able to voice chat while painting and better lighting settings for large paintable sources. Auto Turrets After many many requests we re adding the ability to authorize friends to auto turrets, as well as automatically authorizing yourself when placing the auto turret. Door opening while wounded You ll now need to hold down the interact key to open the door while wounded. Watch out for door campers! Admin UI We ve created a simple admin UI accessible in the menu for server admins to easily modify and administrate their server. This isn t meant to be a replacement for RCON or the console, but hopefully it will act as a simpler way for admins to manage basic elements of their server. If there are more features you d to see feel free to reach out, this is just the first iteration of this tool. Underwater Labs Improvements Since the Underwater Labs release, we been following your feedback closely. The majority of feedback was surrounding high loot density and lack of interaction. We now reduced the map Labs count from to, red and blue keycard spawns, additionally loot crates will no longer spawn while players are nearby. To suit the reduced total number of underwater labs per map, we increased the smallest allowed size per underwater lab. You will no longer find underwater labs that are only a couple of rooms in size, so they should all be worth a visit. Many of you have certainly noticed that the moonpool water was bullet proof. This was an unintended effect from the complexities of dealing with the water carving volumes and has now been fixed. Speaking of moonpools, a human sized version has been in the mix to allow for more points of entry in the labs. Finally, we addressed a number of small glitches in the procedural generation that could cause corridor, iceberg and vegetation overlaps. SUBMARINES Storage Both types of submarine now have storage with slots. Torpedoes The Surface torpedo has been due to players camping underwater with little to no risk. Torpedoes can still be fired at surface targets by surfacing the submarine and firing a standard torpedo. Oxygen Submarines now need to surface for air every ten minutes, either on the ocean surface or in a moon pool. Otherwise, after ten minutes you start taking slow damage. As part of implementing this change, I revamped the oxygen UI a bit, and you can now see how much time you have left from a diving tank as well. Other The rear passenger in a duo sub can now turn all the way around. Sonar blips only show up for other running subs, not every sub that parked in someone base. Procedural Underwater Labs The underwater labs are fully procedural dungeons that reside on the ocean floor. They will come in a variety of shapes and sizes, and for now, with entry points. You enter them from a moonpool in which you with your submarine. From there, make sure you have come prepared to face the various puzzles on offer. The bases have a wide network of CCTV cameras you can connect to to plan your exploration ahead of time. The and improved map will let you see the layout of the base for each floor. You will find microphones in some rooms that let you broadcast your commands into the entire base s network. If you to take risks, the occasional mess hall room will allow you to some high stakes poker, listen to music with your group and cook some meats before heading back to pick a fight with the NPCs that are dwelling in the corridors. Submarines This introduces submarines to. You can now buy a submarine from the boat shops at fishing villages. The submarine seats up to, with internal fuel access and an instrument cluster including rudimentary sonar. Look around behind you and you see interaction UI to swap seats. The submarine seats, with external fuel access and no instruments. Torpedoes Both submarines have torpedo tubes which can fire torpedo types Direct torpedoes fire straight ahead. Surface torpedoes rise to the surface and then speed along the top of the water. You can buy torpedoes from a fishing village vending machine, or craft them yourself. Controls Use movement keys for. Sprint button to rise towards the surface. Crouch button to dive deeper. Look down when in the cockpit to load torpedoes. Fire when in water with the usual shoot button left mouse button by default. Enter underwater bases at moon pool locations, which show up on sonar in the duo sub as red dots. If you in the solo sub, look for the lights being cast down below moon pool modules. Decay Submarines have the same decay style as rowboats and the RHIB. For the first minutes of being unused, they wo decay. Then they start to lose health They last another minutes if left unused outside, or minutes if in deep water. If they indoors and NOT in deep water, they wo ever decay at all. Fishing The Handmade Fishing Rod is now fully functional and ready for use! To get started, you need to equip a bait in the lure slot of the rod. Various foods can be used as bait and their value as a bait is displayed in the item information. As well as food you can now randomly find worms and grubs when collecting resources in the world berries, hemp, potatoes, etc. You have double chance of finding these when harvesting plants planted by a. Once you got a bait ready to simply aim at the water while holding RMB and cast out with LMB. Once you got a bite, you need to reel in the fish. You can use to pull left and right and S to reel the fish in. Fighting the movement of the fish left and right will tire it out and make it move less over time. However reeling in the fish and pulling left and right will put strain on the line, if you strain it too much the line will snap and the fish will get away. The rod will start shaking and you start hearing audio cues when the line is strained, so be sure to stop if your line is about to snap. We types of fish to catch, from Herring, Anchovy and Sardines to Yellow Perch, Catfish, Small Sharks, Salmon and Orange Roughy. Different fish have different conditions for catching, including bait value, water type, water depth and location. As well as gutting the fish for resources, you can take your catches to any fishing village to exchange for scrap. Underwater Ambience Effects We made some to the general underwater look and feel. Visibility has gone up across the board, lighting will get darker the deeper you, and it should just be a bit more engaging than the dive into water and become blind unless you got the magic goggles equipped. Speaking of goggles, the diving goggle screen overlay does self illuminate anymore in darkness, which should make them less distracting to use in. And finally the wet shore look no longer extends deep down into the ocean, which never made any sense in the first place. These are all fairly technical, so expect to see more improvements underwater as we iterate on them in the future. Sharks Exploring the deep may yield great rewards, but with those rewards comes great risks. Each dive site has a chance to spawn a shark which will patrol the area and must be defeated before you are able to claim whatever treasures found at the dive site. You can use a melee weapon in an attempt to defend yourself but your chances of survival are very slim without some kind of underwater ranged weapon Speargun To be able to defend yourself at a distance underwater is of paramount importance given the introduction of hostile marine life. You can now learn how to craft a spear gun ammo from a Level Workbench. This weapon can only be fired while underwater and packs a punch similar to a crossbow, albeit with a slower moving projectile. It is very effective at dispatching hostile human beings. Until now, we have been spawning the workcarts right in front of the rail platforms. Contact System We a system for keeping track of the players you interact with. You find a tab on your inventory screen which will open the contacts panel. From there you be able to use the various controls to flag a as either friendly or enemy. This will change how their name tag shows up when you encounter them in the world. Players are automatically to the category if you been in close proximity for several seconds. Any who kills you will be to your Enemy list. You can select any contact from the list and filter by category as well as assign a contact to a category. Binoculars have received a buff, and will allow you to see a colored pip above players indicating if they are an enemy or a friend. There is a rudimentary reputation system in the works which will very slightly shade your nametag either blue or red based on how likely you are to kill on sight. This system is a work in progress and will be expanded upon in the future. Any server can disable the contacts system with the convar false The nametag system has changed and you can now display your name plate at long distances to anyone you are looking at by using the gesture. We hope this will allow players to avoid killing other players and grant the ability to signal your intentions. As for the majority of hardcore players who kill everyone on sight anyway, you may as well pretend this system does not exist as it will not affect you. However for those less inclined to destroy and kill every living thing that passes infront of them. This system might help you find some players to up with. Wire Colour Coding This was suggested on Reddit and we all felt it was a good idea so I the ability to colour code your electrical wires and hoses this month. Demo Shot System This month we re adding the first iteration of a more advanced feature set for viewing and manipulating demos. This has primarily been built to improve our internal production tools, but considering the rich and diverse community of content creators out there we d love for this to be a tool that all of you can use. Once you load a demo with turned on, you ll see a variety of options including a shot manager and scrubbable timeline. Pressing the ALT key at any time will switch control between the demo UI and debug camera. You can now create and manage within demos, which are individual recordings of camera motion as well as properties such as FOV and DOF. These shots can then be played back with the demo scene. To create a shot, simply press the Shot button, give it a name and then hit record your live camera movement will now be recorded. To end a shot recording, press the Escape key. For management, shots can be sorted into folders, moved between folders, renamed and deleted all from the interface. Folders can be by right clicking on them in the shot list. This current shot system is the first stage of a comprehensive cinematic toolset we ve planned out. Our goal for the future is to expand on this system by adding features such as keyframe editing, redubbing elements of shots, UI for modifying world conditions eg. weather, time of day and export options so you can render your shots into actual video or image files. Are you making videos in? Let us know how this tool can help you! AI The first phase of the AI rework is finished and it replaces multiple different AI systems across different locations with a single. Making to an established as big and complex as is scary, especially due to the multiplayer nature, so there bound to be some initial bugs. Please report anything you find and I get it fixed. The advantages of having everything running on AI system are numerous, the main being it should be easier to keep the AI updated going forwards. features will be easier to add, and they will work across all of the AI, and not just for AI in certain areas or specific monuments. The IFTTT integration depends on having set up on your phone so you can pair your servers so if you are using it already, install the app on your phone! Once you all set up with you need to create or sign into your IFTTT account and head over to the service page on IFTTT where you can link to IFTTT and then build applets. The current IFTTT integration does not support controlling smart switches at the moment this is something we looking into supporting in the future. Updated Animals The animals in have sucked for far too long. They stand out more than ever now with the dropping the amazing world revamp last month. We updated them with brand models and materials, as well as a fuzzy fur shader for the longer bits of hair. This gets culled beyond so we do anticipate a big hit on performance in fact, in the process of updating we discovered each model had a lot of redundant bones which we stripped out! Along with the models came the arduous task of updating rigs, skinning animation. Some animals proved more challenging than others as the updated models correct issues in proportions of the previous models, which meant changing bone placements. Creating controller rigs for the whole suite of animals would of increased the workload by months meant every single existing animation would have needed to be replaced just to get things functional. I decided to try and the current rigs into submission for any animation updates, although as mentioned all redundant bones have been. The idles took quite a while to get something natural, but are a big improvement on what we have. I updated walks some runs where possible, but this is a baseline to build upon. I be looking to more anims, and once the ai becomes more advance we can hopefully increase their and I can start to add more animations to support this. There are current issues with some of the turn movement as well which I to improve and have a greater degree of control over. A Whole World This month has received a huge visual, the biggest to date! From terrain, trees, rocks, cliffs, decor, grass, monument reworks and so much more. This is the culmination of work by several people that took place on and off over the last couple of years. It greatly improves how the feels and gives it a fresh look. Most of the visuals were developed alongside the transition of the to the High Definition Render Pipeline of Unity HDRP that we subsequently dropped after unsatisfactory performance results. We didn t want to waste the efforts made to make the look better during that time and ported them to the current version of the instead. We took the opportunity in the last months leading up to this to fix a vast amount of issues revolving around monuments, world procedural generation, and exploits. For example, you find cliffs, road, terrain, river generation much improved. We some monuments completely such as the Junkyard, Satellite dish and integrated many of them inside the procedurally generated world more seamlessly than before. For example, you now see larger monuments and hubs now have bespoke subway tunnel entrances within their perimeter. When it comes to performance, we did our best to keep the current status quo or improve upon it in some areas of the. But since this adds more content than it removes, we do not expect a major improvement in performance overall. The Bandit Town is known for if not the worst performance area, and this gave us the perfect opportunity to address this. We reduced the number of NPCs, reduced the forest density and completely remodelled the huts. This is only touching the surface of, and you find many more and additions while playing. Gestures You can now express yourself with a selection of gestures, available to everyone in a simple popup menu during gameplay. Just press B by default to open the menu and look at your options. These gestures have been built to be used in first person, so you get nicely animated hand movements instead of just seeing your shadow gesture. This system for gestures is a bit more flexible than the old system, and it has already supports some future features looping animations and third person gestures. A core goal of this gesture system was reducing as much risk as possible when using them during tense gameplay. Gestures will now no longer unequip your weapon and can be cancelled at any point, with a small delay before your weapon is fireable again. Feel free to wave at your victims when roof camping! Fun fact these gestures are all because they were initially meant to be used while holding the weapon at the same time which is generally in the right hand, however we felt it limited our future options for gestures clapping with hand is tricky. As we felt that the quality of the legacy gestures were up to scratch compared to these animations, we made the decision to remove support for playing the old gestures. You can however still bind these gestures using the same if you do want to use the gesture wheel. Deposit at least scrap to the storage at your seat to get started. Once you in a, use the button prompts on the right of the screen to. Standard Texas Hold rules apply. Be sure to take your winnings at the end of your session! While in a poker you have access to a poker chat window for you to chat with your fellow players, and you can use your mic. This release contains mostly fixes, but we been waiting for some of those fixes for a long time and they finally been backported to our LTS version. Mac Improvements Over a year ago, we filed a bug report regarding Unity graphics jobs feature causing a crash on macOS after a few minutes of gameplay. Viewmodel Jitter Fix The view model jitter is finally fixed. It an issue that as old as itself and no it was on purpose. The reason that this happens is because of floating point precision, the further away from you get, the less precise things get. Pretty much every that has View Models, probably has some kind of hack to support them. In the past we did think it was worth using hacks to fix it. HDRP was supposed to allow us to fix this kind of issue, but since we are going to be switching to HDRP I decided to see if I could fix it with some not so Unity features that I pretty sure was available when we started. This month we an underground transit system, slot machines, a round of Twitch drops and more improvements and fixes. Rail Network You now find train entrances scattered across the world, typically you find entrances next to existing monuments. Upon the first inspection, they may not appear to be anything special but after venturing inside deep below the terrain, you now find a vast rail network with drivable workcarts. When entering the train entrances you notice the huge spiral staircases penetrating deep into the terrain, central to the stairs you find a much quicker, but perhaps less safe elevator shaft. Everything in wants you dead, these tunnels are no exception. Upon reaching the bottom of the shafts you encounter some not so friendly tunnel dwellers. From this point forward you likely to encounter many more dwellers if you decide to continue exploring. With risk comes reward, while the dwellers may be unwelcoming the loot they protect could well worth the risk. After exploring the shafts and tunnels you finally be standing at the rail platform. On each platform, you encounter more dwellers but increasingly better loot. At the end of each platform, you find a driveable workcart. Consider this a first pass of a dungeon system. Everything here is procedurally generated and we plan to add track segments, bespoke entrances at each monument, puzzles, NPCs, and eventually use this system to procedurally generate the cave network. Workcarts Each station of the Freight Transit Line will have workcarts facing opposite directions. Running on Low Grade Fuel, these can be used to rapidly traverse the map. There are throttle settings forward and reverse and the vehicle will remain in operation even after you depart the cabin. You may encounter NPC barricades deep in the tunnel system. Be sure to slow down when approaching as hitting barricades or other work carts at high speeds will damage your workcart. Do worry though, when a collision is imminent, a proximity alarm will sound and you can adjust the throttle accordingly. Barricades can be broken through without damage to your cart if approached at low speed. If you encounter a track junction, you can use your left or right strafe key to choose which track to follow. Lastly, damage will slow the speed of a workcart and it can be repaired with a hammer for metal fragments. Slot Machines Test your luck with Slot Machines in the gambling room of Bandit Town. To operate the Slot Machine you need to mount it and then deposit Scrap to start betting. Each bet is Scrap and the payouts range anywhere from to Scrap. Be sure to grab your winnings and any unused betting Scrap before leaving. Good luck! Server Browser As I sure many people are aware, there are quite a few issues with the server browser. You will likely never be able to see every server out there due to the how implements this functionality, but it can be improved. I made a few internal to the server browser to improve discoverability of servers Empty servers are now hidden by default Unless you on the official, friends, history, or favorites tabs they will always be shown here Note This means you will need to enable showing empty servers sometimes The Show Empty filter will now apply filtering within This means when Show Empty is off you should see no empty servers and see more of them Toggling the Show Empty filter will a refresh of the community and modded tabs We made the tags look less terrible. We working towards a UI refresh for the server browser so the filtering will improve even more in the future. We always working on cleaning up the server list to remove servers that are spamming, advertising, or lying to try and get ahead. Server Performance Whilst looking through the server profiles recently, We noticed that certain entities were updating and sending data more than they needed to. of the biggest offenders were entities with buoyancy boats and horses. Now we try our best to not them if there are any players around or they are in use. Combining these fixes with some fixes that Jarryd made with entity flag networking, servers should handle more players a bit better both in terms of CPU and bandwidth usage. Family Share Players abusing family share to circumvent bans and other malicious behaviour is not uncommon, on February we disable family sharing for the foreseeable future. We currently have no plans to family share. Surfs Up The Sunburn DLC is our second premium DLC for, including summer themed items for you to enjoy with your. Gear up in some swimwear, take to the seas, relax by the pool, get into a water fight and take some photos to remember the summer! Just the Instruments DLC everything included in this pack except for the custom underwear can be used by anyone, even if they have purchased the DLC. Make sure to craft some tubes for your friends! Custom Underwear We the ability for you to change your underwear as part of this so you can swap out those grungy undies with some bright summer styles. You notice a icon next to your avatar in the Inventory where you can select from the available options. This works a little differently from normal items as it not something you have to equip or craft, and your choice of underwear will be remembered when you die. There are different styles to choose from with Male and Female versions of each. Boogie Board and Inner Tube The Boogie Board and Inner Tube are deployable vehicles that let you take to the ocean in style. Pop down in any body of water and you can paddle around to your heart content. The Inner Tube is a bit slower but can turn easily, while the Boogie Board is built for speed but ca turn as well. You can equip items while on an Inner Tube, so feel free to shoot your mates with a water gun while catching some waves. The Boogie Board has visual styles while the Inner Tube has styles. Paddling Pool Once filled up, the Paddling Pool acts as a water source for your Boogie Board and Inner Tubes. Includes different styles. Above Ground Pool The Above Ground Pool is a massive pool with plenty of space for aquatic activities. As well as including a large pool, it includes a deck area where you can deploy other props chairs, instruments and turrets. Beach Towel The Beach Towel is a item that acts as a respawn point. While it works well on the beach and by the pool, it will work anywhere you can use a Sleeping Bag. Comes in styles so you can stand out on the beach. Beach Recliner, Parasol and Table This furniture set includes three separate props to style your above ground pool. The Recliner is a large chair where you can kick back and relax, the Parasol is a large umbrella that reduces the temperature for any players underneath it, and the Table is a small surface that goes well with the rest of the furniture. The Parasol and Recliner have different colour schemes to pick from. Sunglasses Shield your eyes from the hot sun with the equippable Sunglasses. Provides no protection, but they look cool. Includes different styles so you can express yourself. Instant Camera Snap photos of your summer fun with the Ontara Pro instant camera. You can write messages onto the photos and share them with others notes. Each camera can take up to photos. The camera has a zoom feature which can be adjusted by dragging with the right mouse button pressed. It can switch between infinite, auto, or manual focus using the reload button. Manual focus can be adjusted with mouse drag. Photo Frames You can place your photos into these deployable photo frames to show them off to the world. Hold E on them to access its inventory and swap the photos out. You can paint over the frame signs! Water Guns Water fights to the death! Grab a water gun, fill it up from a water source and on a splashing spree! Soak your mates or enemies as long as they have a water gun equipped, too enough and they start to take water damage. The water pistol has a low output and range, but does require pumping. The larger water gun has increased range and output but will need pumping to maintain its extended range. The large gun comes in colours for easy friend and foe identification.

It fun to get a look at how the sausage is made in, and a developer Garry Newman opened the doors to his butcher shop in a blog post today. a The post reveals that Newman has wanted for years to let players look down in and see their own legs while playing, rather than traveling through the world as a disembodied camera in the same manner as most. We have a skeleton with the model on it which is what casts the localplayer shadow, the post reads. We want to show it, but we want to manipulate the bones in a way that they do conflict with the view. But if we do that the shadow would be all fucked. The solution Newman finally came up with? Rendering a different model. So what we do is basically copy the third person model which creates the shadows and manipulate the bones. The manipulation is anything complicated, it just a case of tucking shit behind the camera, Newman writes. em Above a made from video at There a couple of extra things we have to do. When you crouched and look down, we pull the viewmodel back so it does clip through your knees. While that solution does indeed look convincing from a perspective above, it both funny and a little alarming to see what happening behind the scenes to achieve it em Above a em Gif made from video at As you can see, the shadow is intact and both it and their body will look perfectly normal to them, but tucking shit behind the camera technically turns the into a weird stretched taffy monster. It reminiscent of a the disturbing gymnastics required to let players peer over cover in Crysis. You can the full post for more magic there a reason the models above do show the arms a at Newman blog. a is interesting, and infuriating, largely because it is completely without rules. Players can work cooperatively, and they can murder each other without penalty. Trading is a big part of surviving, and getting shot in the face while you trying to do a deal is a big part of not surviving. What a poor soul, dropped naked and alone into the midst of a cold, rocky wilderness, to do? The Compound promises to help alleviate the stresses of such business by adding a place where players can safely interact under the protective watchful eye of scientists. It will provide useful services and facilities including a refinery, workbenches, a recycler, a, and vending machines that sell basic survival resources, and a place where you can just kick back and be social if that your thing. The rules are simple No weapons, no looting, no killing, and no sleeping inside, or directly outside, the compound. Follow the rules and you can hang out to your heart content. Break them, and the scientists and their turrets will kill you dead. You be marked as hostile for five minutes and the status will persist across death, meaning you ca rush back into the compound immediately after you die The only option once you been marked is to wait it Facepunch acknowledged that the compound is probably going to be gamed pretty hard, but said that it will continue iterating on it in order to stay abreast of players trying to dick around with the system. It pointed an amusing finger at the base for forcing developers to take this step in the first place We originally intended for people to set up these kind of zones with peacekeeper turrets, but after a year and bothering we took matters into our own hands. The adds a set of scuba gear to the that facilitates underwater operations, and underwater rock formations, because what the point of scuba diving if there nothing down there to see? makes better use of voice chat than any I ever played. You are naked and alone on the world silliest island. There is no narrator or announcer, so instead you submerge in the quietude of the unkempt grass crunching beneath your feet, as you uselessly smash your rock against the nearest pine tree. Perhaps you harvested some mushrooms and a few bundles of flax enough to stave off the hunger pangs and fashion yourself a burlap shawl to cover your shame. If you particularly industrious, you have furnished a nice wooden shack a stone throw away from some fresh water and reliable resources the homestead necessary for any successful campaign. But then you hear it. Faintly at first. Carried on the tip of the breeze. It another idiot in I do know what it is with this. Maybe it the fact that you spawn unclothed and uncensored, maybe it the brutal vastness of the design, or maybe it the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings, but has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat merges with the draw distance, so when you spotted by an idiot, you start hearing the quietly tickling your ear. They get closer, they get louder and more confident, and suddenly you hopping over shotgun shells while absorbing an entire dictionary of insults. No has ever indulged our lack of humanity quite, and I wish I did mean that as an endorsement. It so hilariously antagonistic that I wish I could say I did love it. I wish I could say that it did feel incredible when of those naked idiots charged me with their rock and I switched to the axe I fashioned out of scrap metal which he almost certainly did know I was carrying, and put him down with a single. I wish I could tell you that, as I was standing over his fatally wounded body, that I did laugh my ass off when my headphones were filled with the voice of a prepubescent boy shouting, em Hey man, wait a second! I wish I could say I did kill him anyway. No has ever indulged our lack of humanity quite, and I wish I did mean that as an endorsement. If it feels we been living with for a long time, that because we kinda have. The was first in Early Access in late by developers Facepunch Studios, and it been a mainstay of goofy YouTube ever since. If you somehow unfamiliar with the premise, think of as a dumber, more nihilistic Minecraft. You wake up on a map armed with only a rock and a torch. You quickly figure out that, by banging your rock on a few environmental doodads, you can harvest a few basic resources stone, wood, and cloth which you can parlay into a few prehistoric instruments, a spear or a hatchet. This is similar to the scrounging mechanics in plenty of other survival, but what makes different is how deep that tech tree goes. Eventually, from those same basic ingredients and a few mechanical leaps of faith work benches and furnaces, you be able to craft pistols, flamethrowers, and rocket launchers. famously does not quarter off its servers to keep nakeds away from the roving troops suited up in advanced firearms, which means that occasionally, your journey will end with you matching another revolver with a rock that you tied to a stick. This is the heart of. Wake up naked, run for your life, do horrible things to another. There is no grander narrative, or mythos, or win condition. Most of the servers are on a strict weekly or monthly reset schedule, which scrubs the island of any lingering housing or fortifications left behind by the players, which gives the experience a strange sense of futility. Yes, you will need to manage your hunger, thirst, and health and as you ratchet up the tech tree you will discover increasingly effective ways to stay alive but that it. Sure there are some areas on the map that are stricken with radiation, which leads to the implication that perhaps you and the rest of your misanthropes are occupying a, society, but those moments feel more window dressing than anything else. I spent the vast majority of my time in playing solo, but I do want to discount the notorious community of players that band together in clans, and wage wars of aggression along the shared hunting grounds. of the fascinating kernels of brutality is how everything in the world remains persistent, even if you logged off, which means that smart players arm their bases with land mines, punji sticks, and keypad locks while they away. Some clans even recruit players across all time zones, to make sure there always someone on guard. That a coordination I appreciated from a distance. There are a number of YouTube documentarians a showing off the raids that spawn from committed Discord channels all over the world. Instead, I engaged with the population of on a purely incidental level. An extremely geared man takes pity on you, and drops a crossbow at your quivering feet. That! A kid and I are raiding an abandoned gas station for food and weapons, and I give him the extra pair of pants I was carrying around. When I turned the other direction, he bashes his rock right through my skull and runs off with the rest of my stuff. That is. I utterly entranced with how little faith it has in our ability to get along. Given the tone, it should be surprising that the community I found in tended to be fairly juvenile and toxic. There a high concentration of racism and misogyny in the chat, so much so that I eventually left the channel And unsurprisingly, the experience is quite prickly. The development did spend any time cooking up a tutorial which makes some sense, when you consider how long the has been available. Instead, when you join of the many servers, you presented with a few faint hints in the corner of the screen harvest wood! build a hatchet! The crafting system itself is fairly intuitive, with tooltips for each of the items in the catalog, and you can yourself into some serious munitions if you get lucky with a few resource spawns. The PvP combat wo win any awards, but it tactile and packed with wonderfully sadist sound effects connecting your hatchet with an idiot head feels great, and, that all I needed. a There is a strange monetization model, in which you can buy ugly for your weapons and clothing. is fascinating for a hundred different reasons, but em style AWPs is of Still though, I think everyone should at least have a taste of. It hard to think of many other that are this uncompromising in its worldview, and I utterly entranced with how little faith it has in our ability to get along. We could build a utopia on this island! We could cast aside our weapons, and construct a peaceful commune where everyone is fed, warm, and loved. I love how Facepunch dangles that potential in front of our face, with no real incentive pushing us in any direction. If we are to dehumanize ourselves, and turn this Eden into a battlefield, we will do it on our own terms. In there is a real sense of complicitness when you eventually succumb to violence, more potent than in any other survival on the market. Despite the lack of rankings to chase, or to nurture, or exclusive vendors to unlock despite the unassailable fact that none of this will matter as soon as the server is wiped we are at war, and we always will be.

s may have popularised the genre inspired by the Japanese movie, but it s not the only pitting players against each other in desperate fights to the death. Below are, modes and mods that you should check out if you can t get enough of hunting your fellow man. Let s get the current top dog out of the way first, shall we? a, or, is still in Early Access, but it s already swallowed up the lives of millions of players. In each match, survivors are air dropped into a bucolic Russian island, seemingly abandoned during or just after the Soviet era. It s a huge place, but the area is always shrinking, forcing players to race towards safety on foot or using cars, bikes and boats, all while trying to murder each other with a wide range of guns and melee weapons. It s a filled with long moments of quiet tension, punctuated by chaotic, battles. King of the Kill Another Early Access, a King of the Kill was spun out of Daybreak s zombie survival. The survival aspect became its own separate, Just Survive, while the more competitive, PvP side of things became King of the Kill. Frenetic and, it s more of an arena shooter than a, so you won t have to wait long to get into a gunfight. Brendan Greene was a consultant on before making. Ark Survival of the Fittest, a Survival of the Fittest is another, and is similarly a. Its hook, not surprisingly given its progenitor, is that there are dinosaurs and monsters to watch out for, as well as human adversaries potentially hunting you down. Other elements from Survival Evolved have made it in, too, including riding and taming creatures, tribes and traps. Unfortunately, it s struggled to retain its playerbase in the face of. The Culling If you prefer royales of the more intimate variety, there s a Culling and its and arenas. Though it s, there s still time to craft equipment and set traps. The central conceit is a big draw, too, set as the is in a crazed show for sadists. It s been in Early Access since March, and while it was popular initially, it looks numbers might be on the wane. Last Man Standing Budget is probably the clearest way to describe a Man Standing. It s set on an island with players trying to kill each other, the area is a big circle that shrinks over time, mods can be scavenged and attached to guns, it s got loot crates there s a long list of similarities, but Last Man Standing is free. It s not quite as polished as its premium counterpart, however. MODES GTA Online, Motor Wars GTA Online recently got a competitive mode called Motor Wars, which has some similarities to popular a shrinking kill box, arriving from the sky, then finding the best weapons possible on the ground. The key difference is that it more focused around vehicle combat, and all the cars are marked on the map, as well as the players driving them. The shrinking kill space provides a similar amount of tension, though, and there tons more potential in building on the idea, given the size of the map they got to with. a had fun with it, even though it has some flaws. Fortnite Epic has announced a mode for their romp, Fortnite. It s due out this month and will see up to players duking it out until there s only left. The mode was put together by Epic s Unreal Tournament, who were busy experimenting while Fortnite was in development. The scavenging and building from the s regular mode will feature in this, so you ll be able to create bases and fortifications to hole up in while you wait for everyone else to die. They ll probably be doing the same, mind you. Unturned a is a blocky, zombie survival, but it s got a arena mode. It s as straightforward as a can be, but there s odd wrinkle you can t damage people with your fists, so you d better get a weapon as quickly as you can. The latest to the multiplayer survival goat rodeo a makes what sounds a number of fairly significant to gameplay, particularly regarding guns, which for better or worse are an important part of the. Facepunch Maurino Berry explained in a that the to firearms three of them, are meant to address complaints that the recoil in is screwy and unfun, and collectively make the action feel a little bit more in line with traditional shooters. First, you going to notice less horizontal recoil so it be easier to maintain your target. Secondly, you going to notice that, for rifles, the first shot is pretty much dead accurate and the longer you hold down the trigger the more inaccurate it gets by way of an increasing aimcone. This means you be able to tap at targets for high accuracy or you can risk spraying more rounds down range which are less likely to hit their targets, Berry wrote. Lastly, I implemented recoil compensation. This means if you holding down the trigger and the weapon is riding up, as soon as you let of the trigger it will correct back to the original aim position. The cost of weapons have been adjusted slightly as well The Thompson now costs ten HQM high quality metal less to craft than prior to the, while the pump shotgun and laser sight cost five HQM less. Shotgun accuracy is going up a bit thanks to the discovery that accuracy cones were actually being calculated as accuracy pyramids. And if, for some reason, you do the recoil compensation feature, it can be disabled by entering false at the Other in the include the addition of drop boxes, the return of dynamic moon phases, and the start of a overhaul of Hapis Island. A quick rundown of everything and changed can be pumped directly into your eyeballs via the video below.

Facepunch Studios boss Garry Newman has some advice for a players who have grown bored with the Stop playing it. He acknowledged that the sentiment may come across as dismissive, but said in a message a Reddit that it necessary to break the loop that holding the back from full I noticing a pattern, and we need to address it. It something we need to get past as a community, not only because it getting boring but because it has wider implications, he wrote. We stuck in ping pong loop. We release an, you love it for a month, you get bored, blame the system, bitch for a few months, then we release another and the same thing happens. His concern is that the pattern will persist indefinitely, because the real problem is that the systems are better than the old ones, but simply that they fresher. But Facepunch obviously ca keep overhauling the forever, and thus Newman suggests a clean break for those unhappy with. But he asked that people who do end up quitting, or who think his attitude is unfair, give thought to whether we have given you enough entertainment over the last three years to justify pocketing your before getting angry. If you interested in the, if you regularly and still get enjoyment when you we definitely interested to hear what you think. We especially love hearing your stories, watching your videos, seeing your screenshots and paintings all things that this subreddit has been very low on, Newman wrote. If we want to leave Early Access then breaking this loop has to be part of that plan. We have a pretty good idea on how to push forward with, but none of it is going to make the more appealing to people that have spent their last hours hating it. As silly as it sounds, it actually very easy to find players with more than hours in giving it negative reviews a. of them are on the front page, along with a few negative reviews of them, with more than hours on record, came about at least in part in response to Newman statement. It an unfortunate reaction, but probably inevitable, too Sooner or later, every developer has to settle on what exactly they trying to make, and no matter how good that final concept may be, somebody, somewhere, is going to be mad about it.

This past week brought some big to the way the survival works, including the removal of the XP and levelling system. Developer Facepunch Studios detailed why players wo level up in anymore, noting that it completely changed the feel of as a sandbox. Facepunch Maurino Berry explained how the was no longer about encounters and enjoying your time in the world, but instead about how to level up as quickly as you can. This resulted in the becoming boring once you had levelled to the max, making for an unsustainable gameplay model. items we have even thought of yet would need to be hacked into certain levels, which would cause a never ending balance nightmare and item bloat it was already ridiculous when you reach a level and have things unlocked, Berry continued. Eventually we to never have to wipe and just have decay and resource management take care of the server, XP was not compatible with this goal without all kinds of workarounds and hacks forced in some sort of prestige system. Berry concluded with the fact that XP negated the lemonade out of lemons feel that excels at, where your loadout would be consisted of whatever you could find and use. Replacing XP is the component system, which makes everything craftable from the moment you start. This means no more locked items or blueprints. However, items beyond basics require the use of a component to craft, and these can only be discovered in the world components ca be crafted. Additionally, players will see the return of radiation, which has been remixed a bit. You can more about the latest on the devblog a here. note that Berry makes is an issue where the chugs and pauses periodically. He says that if players experience this, they should press and send an error report to the developer, mentioning you experiencing the same issue highlighted in the devblog.
